title: I wanna Father another Child!
text:
This may seem strange and is, but I have fathered three children during/in my marriage, Plus two or three others using my sperm to help relatives of my ex-wife. One was by invetro another was by eggs harvested and with a surrogate mother. The third time was kinda strange (on the cheap), my wife provided enough to a gay friend for a DIY. (I never asked how! But she also had a healthy child.)
So that is a total of six health children. I have lost or never had contact with the last three children, The youngest would now be in his/her late teens. I'm told, through other family connections that the three, from donor sperm are all highly intelligent and high achievers as are my own three sons.

A few years ago, my ex-wife contacted me about doing this again, I had my sperm tested and even in my 60s it still tested good. This donation never happened due to other family problems.

Why am I here? Over the past few months I have seen several posts here on CL for sperm donations and I have responded to several of them, offering mine. I have yet to have any takers and I can only assume it is because of my age. Well, you should talk with you fertility specialist and get their opinion. I know from my experience, it really doesn't seem to matter. 

I don't ask for anything and if you can afford the lab type invetro fine. Or, if money is tight, my sperm is freely given and you can DIY. ("if at first you don't succeed, try, try again!") 

As I state above, I don't ask for anything, but really that would be irresponsible of me since I want the best for any child and since I have a choice here, I want make sure they will be born into a loving and happy home. And with all the opportunities my own natural children have. For that reason and at the parents option I want to offer to stay in touch with the parents and perhaps in time with the child. 

Think this over and if your seriously interest, just reply and we can discuss or have a Q&A on the details. (I'm not getting any younger but my Sperm is fresh daily!)

title: Best friend, I know you're out there
text:
Hello out there!! 

There comes a time in your life where you realize that you need a few great friends or that one best friend. This is what I am after. I am a unique individual who loves to be adventurous and dabble in all sorts of fun. I just noticed that all of my friends have a best friend, and I still don't who is local. I just seem to not feel a connection with anyone but it's not going to stop me from trying. 

About me- 

I am 38, I'm happily married (and by happily married, I truly mean that) I have two amazing boys who are the starshine and sunshine of my planet. We live in Tukwila and have been here for the last two years. We moved here from Oregon, so that is another reason why I am seeking friends on craigslist. I work full time during the week. 

I am terrible at this sort of thing. I am not an emailer, and it seems that most of the people that I do meet off here just want to email back and forth. I will not do that. I think my email limit is three, this is the first. . .
So if that is something that you plan to do, I am not your girl. With that said, I have recently figured out that I really need to have a connection before meeting up. I am spread pretty thin as most are, and meeting several people per week will just be too much. I will be down to meet up with someone I feel connected with, so it's going to have to be texts first. 

I have a gypsy soul. I'm eclectic, I am quirky and fun, but usually reserved at first. I am that person who would do anything for anyone. I am open and honest, non judgmental and completely mentally stable. I enjoy to be happy and in a great mood. I do not do well with over- negativity, mean spirited people or preachy people. Everyone says that they don't like drama, but I repel it. I am spiritual. This might sound odd, but agnostic -pagan (raddest thing ever would be for someone to get that). I am not going to change my mind, so I really don't want people to try for it bores me. Politics are just not my thing but this election tho!!! 

I am a music lover of all types (all kinds, but rap, r & b, bluegrass, folk and rockabilly are my right now favs (I am aware of the crazy mix), art, books, antiques, shopping, being girly, movies, nutrition, tattoo's, dancing, walking, collecting feathers, coffee & tea, gardening, concerts, succulents, jug bands, vaudeville. I love going to concerts when possible, small or big shows. I love anything vintage, rusty, musty and in bad condition. Antique shopping, thrift & book stores or walking the beach looking for driftwood is where you can usually find me. I am very into mindfulness and meditation. I love to wander downtown with my cuppa coffee in hand and explore new tasty foods & shopping. I am a girly girl, but not too willing to spend too much on maintenance. I'd rather do it myself. I love the written word, movies, dancing, adventure. I can cook something fierce, and love to entertain. 

I am very into nutrition. I am extremely happy with myself and even my body. However; I am trying to get into perfect health, and work out a lot. I am addicted to my fitbit. It would be nice to meet someone who is also working on that, while not having extreme body image issues. 

I am looking for someone who is like minded, kind, daring, fun. Between the ages of 30-40. Married or not, don't really care. Kids, great but mine won't be tagging along as they are older. I work 8-5 m-f. Don't care if you do or not, but those are my normal hours. l'd love to find someone willing to meet up, talk on the phone once in a while, and spend some good ol fashioned "girl time" with. I would love to meet someone up for dancing, concerts- shows, thrift shopping, garage sale-ing, going downtown, working out, seeing a chick flick. For me, life is too short for excuses, I like to live in the now. My only real requirement is that you must be in the same frame of mind for having a friendship. No sourpusses or chronically depressed, no fakes and most importantly be genuine. 

If you think I might be someone you could get along with, hit me up. I know my best friend is out there, so I'll keep posting this til I find her.

Thanks for reading. 

*Please put your favorite song/artist in title of email to void out fakes & spam- thanks *

title: Down to earth, good women
text:
Hi! 
I recently moved to Lacey and could use a chill, relaxed friend. I'm a girl who's down to earth, loves to learn, outdoorsy, and very goofy. You should be kind, open, funny, and smart. Oh and 420 friendly :) I don't drink hard alcohol, but wine and beer sometimes. I've been in a relationship with my boyfriend for 4 years.

I'm not materialistic, I'm more of a natural girl and health conscious. I like to crochet, sew, paint, and learn all types of new skills. 

I feel like I would be fine living like they did in the olden days, minus the dysentery. Haha. Just the idea of living off the land, making things myself, and being in nature seems peaceful.

I dislike mainstream media 
and music. I feel like it's dumbing down soceity.

I love spending time outdoors camping, fishing, vegetable gardening, beekeeping, and exploring nature. I love our mother earth and I enjoy being active. I am very much into being one with the earth. I really like walking barefoot when it's warm.

I'm not into partying, drama or gossip. I don't like being mean or negative. I like good vibes and creating good intentions.

I watch documentaries, learn about natural law, natural healing, health, nutrition, fitness, chinese medicine, native american cultures, psychology, physics, history, and science.

title: Brew/Book Budd(y/ies)
text:
Hey there! We are a glorious young adult trifecta looking for some quality friends. Our relationships to each other: two sisters, plus the partner of one sister. We thought we'd be upfront about the fact that we're mostly always together. All relatively new to the Tacoma area, we are having a hard time making connections organically outside of busy professional lives. It's difficult finding the space to meet people with similar interests when you are looking for friendship, not a romantic relationship.

Some interests of mine (the married sister) include cooking adventurous new recipes, going to new restaurants (recently we went on a doughnut crawl, followed by a slow quest for Tacoma's best pizza that we, my partner, sister, and I, could use some help on), seeing movies at The Grand Cinema, occasionally going to sporting events, always going to new breweries, running, slam poetry, and drag shows, among other things. I love Andrea Gibson, hard cider/IPA's, cheese, talking about film, and hosting dinner parties. Some of my favorite movies are Donnie Darko, American Beauty, Spotlight, Burnt, Doubt, The Other Sister, and Jaws. I'm honestly not huge into music, but I think this makes me a good ride-along buddy because I'm not picky about what's playing in the car. A few things I'd really like to do with a new friend would be to try a couple of the newer breweries in Tacoma, perhaps read a book together (mini-book club!), watch Netflix and bake stuff, and mainly, just get to know each other and support each other. I'm more interested in an actual consistent friendship than someone to have occasional crazy adventures with.

Some of my interests (I'm the sister/eternal third wheel) include movies, modern art, crafting, lindy hop, and antiques. My favorite movies are Fantastic Mr. Fox, Argo, Spotlight, and Her. I love crocheting and reading. I am a fan of beer and whiskey, and most foods. I am looking for fun meaningful friendships!

If you're looking for this pod of awesomeness, please shoot us a message with your favorite beer or cider as the subject line! We're looking for either groups or individuals to hang with.

title: Single father of two, looking for platonic, Woman/Women 4 Friends, Yes
text:
I am a pretty good looking guy if I say so myself, but I am a single father of two beautiful girls, that keep Daddy on his toes. I am not looking for anything sexual. Not looking for any emotional drama, I am just looking for a woman or women who are looking for the opposite male counterpart for going out, being that wingman for ya, and you can be my wingwoman for me. Bring your lady friends, thats fine, its all platonic. Again, I love being a father, its the best job ever, but sometimes, its fun to spend time with other company outside my current circle of friends, and outside my circle of work friends. 

Life is too short, I would just like to meet a woman or women who just want to explore something, groupon something, check out a movie, then go home back to our lives, grab dinner, catch up, then go home back to our daily lives..etc.. You get the picture.

Me... for the most part, just a regular single father, I work out, I am not a gym rat, but I do have muscles in the places that matter, meaning my brain! Ha! What were you thinking. Seriously, I work in IT, I am a nerd by day, goofy 24x7, have a home, car, two great kids, pay 90% of my bills, that toll bill is just killing me right now! Just a regular guy. Please care about your health, your looks, as I do. I am not perfect, and I don't need a barbie doll of a friend( but if you are, thats great too!), but it you like to work out and or do events like the tough mudder, or warrior dash, you can join me! The Warrior Dash is this July, I am training for it. They say opposites attract. I say they do, and I also say the same people attract, when its all about friendship. If you are just friends, it doesn't matter if you don't agree on topics, respect each other and what they believe, and keep it moving. Life is too short for drama. I am easy to talk to. title: The Anti-dating post
text: I'm posting here in the plutonic area because I realized after a few dates that I am not ready for jumping in and finding my next ex. I do miss adult companionship to go do things with. I work hard and would like to play hard too. My weekend consisted of going for a walk, going shopping, going out to eat, going to the casino just to have a drink and people watch and going to the movies... By Myself! Yes it's good to get out but it's embarrassing sometimes. People stare, feel sorry for me or I attract the ones who have liquor bravery, think I'm desperately lonely and have no standards or they see a neon "come play me" light with an arrow pointing my way. Sometimes when I go out I am reminded why I don't want to go out, well not alone anyways. I don't want to miss out on life and experiences and cool stuff and "dating" is not the answer for me at this time. I am not emotionally available for romance, right now it seems like "the one" for me just simply does not exist and I desire the impossible or just can't have my cake and eat it too. I accept this and live accordingly but someone to share things and experiences with is on my mind. I am a single white female, unique, attractive, good job, place, fun, loyal, sexy, no drugs, social drinks sometimes, 420 friendly... Thrill seeker but also like cozy relaxing moments... I don't date white men because I am not playboy centerfold material or a live flexi doll and Huh!? or Duh??? are not the biggest words in my vocabulary. I do have common interests like nature and hiking, camping, bonfires, music, BBQ, family, concerts, travel and road trips, festivities and more... There's just never a mutual physical attraction. Also, most black men I've met don't share my same passion for nature and thrill seeking and hate Washington and the weather. My personality is kind of eccentric, I like a well balanced mix of work & play, serious & silly and so on. Things I would like to do "not alone" are: travel, road trips, concerts, dinners, fairs and festivities, movies, roasting hot dogs and making smores... I really truly seek a trusting friend, partner in crime so to speak (not literally) and someone to confide in... vise sersa. Journey, explore, experience and take pictures- Lot's of pictures :) I want to go to Vegas in the very near future, a small group of fun girls and a man would be fun lol Also camping, I reserve the same spot every year for up to 12 people but this year I have only a few friends that may be able to go. I have looked into classes like cooking and photography & art and that meet ups thing but everything is so far and few in-between and I'm not looking to be a certified chef or own a $6000.00 camera. Can I just use my Samsung Galaxy!?? Something else I want to do is Geocatching- I tried once and had a blast! I also love the market (Pikes Place) I would like to discover other places to get fresh produce and unique herbs and spices... Spring and summer on the way- Lot's to do!!! And for Fall, my favorite! The colors and smells and coziness and HALLOWEEN!!! I like all holidays actually and am a go all out person too. I think I just need trusting friends and day by day things just seem better and then one day when someone asks how you are and you reply "good" you actually mean it :)

title: Guy That Shouldn't Be On CL Seeks Girl That Shouldn't Be On CL
text:
Hi,

So, I'm the guy that shouldn't be on Craigslist. Why, you ask? What makes me so special? 

Well.. I have a doctorate degree, I'm fairly attractive, social, generally good with women (although my game has taken a hit here in Seattle, I mean c'mon, the dating scene here stinks), I'm financially well-off, I'm not married, divorced, kids, or STD's. Hmm. Sounds like a decent situation huh? I'm cool too. I might not participate in certain shit-shows (because of my career), but that doesn't mean I won't cheer you on. I let you be you. The best you. 

I'll be honest, socially I'm generally "the man" in other places I've lived but I've struggled a lot in Seattle. Maybe blame it on the freeze? I don't know. But that's why I'm here.

You:
You feel guilty for being on craigslist, or maybe you don't but your friends would feel guilty for you. You KNOW you could do so much better. And not because you live in Bonney Lake with your 2nd child on your arm, and you're bored because you've been out of work for a year and you're "so" done with this town. No no dear, you just need to find a new hobby. The type of woman I'm talking about, this woman... she KNOWS she shouldn't be on craigslist because you have a graduate degree (or are in a well secure career with your bachelors), you're attractive, independent, you're healthy and cool, and maybe like me you're struggling a bit meeting friends or people that inspire you.... Well until you read this. Because that's over now. So, Hit me baby, one more time! I'm waiting for you. 

Race doesn't matter. Clearly I'm black. So minorities are cool, and cool white people are cool too. :) Age 24-35? I think that's fair. Big booties to the front of the line. Awesome wing women will tell others to get IN-LINE. 

Send a pic or no reply! :)

title: Church Girl Years Ago
text:
I grew up in a small town and attended a Baptist Church like many other good little boys. This extraordinarily precocious girl, C. S., also attended the church. I knew her all through junior high and high school. She wore these exceedingly tight skirts, nylons, and heels, tight knit blouses too. Since our preacher had convinced us that we were going to roast in hell for our wayward thoughts, mine seemingly, inevitably, became even more stimulated, wayward, and elaborate. I still remember the parties where she wore similar things, perhaps even tighter fitting, than she wore in church. She would sit on my lap and I would rest my hand on her textured nylon legs. I suspect she knew full well what was going on beneath her.
I wish that I could go back to that time and place knowing what I know now.
Any C.S.'s out there who always wanted to make it with the smartest, most sought after, best athlete in town? who went on to the big city and to some very rewarding things but who has always had you in the back of his mind somewhere, wondering if you were feeling the same thing he was all those years? Perhaps still are? Even platonically. Then there was S. S. and K. S. too.
Appreciation and/or quid pro quo's of all sorts considered.
Take me back and forward. Hint: small logging town; G. Creek
Please: no "trade" ladies bother respond.

title: Seeking 55+ friends closer to home - w4w or w4m
text:
I'd like to meet good people who live in Renton, south Seattle, Factoria, Newcastle, Kent and other areas within about a 15-mi. radius of Renton who are ~55 and up in age. Please be a reliable person who follows through after emailing, not so busy that you never can find time to socialize, and someone who plans to remain in the area. Thank you for reading the entire ad before replying to it with answers to the PLEASE NOTE paragraph below.

Are you looking for real, long-term, reliable friends rather than just acquaintances? I'm also ready to meet new friends closer to home who are kind and considerate to share good conversation and activities. How about you? Do you love nature and getting out into it? Art and music? Let's meet at a cafe for a conversation or get out for a park walk and chat on a good weather day and go from there.

People who are adventurous, will try new things and are curious about life in general are my favorite types of friends. My interests include almost anything that's outdoors in decent weather - good walks and hikes; having a good conversation; musical events; good movies, plants/gardening and public gardens; little road trips, and lifelong learning about all types of things including other cultures. Indoor pursuits like conversation over coffee, museums, dinner, talks, hearing music of many types and the like are great when the weather may not be cooperative. I'm hoping you share some of those interests and also want to meet someone who will share some of your unique interests and offers mutual support. I'm a non-smoker (you too, please) and occasionally have a wine or drink. We don't need any of this to have a good time, however. 

I'm a truly good person, have a sense of humor, and am a good friend who remembers birthdays, pays attention to what friends say, and tells them about news or activities I think will interest them. I'm also an empathetic person who will help friends in whatever way I can whenever I can. I'm intelligent, but not intellectual, have a spiritual side but am not religious. (No proselytizers, please) I'm reliable and look for other people who are too, as well as people who are kind, good people who have most of those qualities. Nobody is perfect, of course.

PLEASE NOTE: Please email and include where you are (city/neighborhood), a bit about your personality and interests, and days/time windows you're generally available to socialize. Please be close to the boomer age range and in the areas posted in the first paragraph above. If you'd like to send along your number in addition to a self-description to shortcut things, you can definitely trust me with it. 

If you're fit enough to get out for at least brisk walks, that would be great. I'm fairly fit for this age. I was born elsewhere, have been in the Northwest more than half a lifetime and have interest in meeting people from everywhere. If you're overly concerned with superficiality over substance, we very likely would not be compatible. Otherwise, I look forward to hearing from you soon! [Sorry, not looking to meet married people or couples. It doesn't generally work out that well.]

title: Getting to know someone new. Pen-pal, email friends
text:
Hello!

First off I am 29, very happily married, and would never change or hurt that, but I really enjoy getting to know new people, that are okay keeping it platonic, or risking any harm to anyone's relationship. I am also from Texas, and enjoy getting to know people from other areas as it removes the pressure to meet if there is a connection, and keep relationships safe. 

I work from home most days, which also means I don't do much on those days, and it would be great to have someone new to get to know and share things with. I'm very open minded, goofy, extremely laid back, I don't judge, I'm allergic to drama, I can be really sarcastic but I know when to turn it off, easy to talk to, and I've had an interesting and unique life so far, so I think I have quite a few interesting things/stories to share. I also have a bit of a dirty mind, and might throw a "that's what she said" into a conversation at some point. I am also a major night owl, so if you are too, even better!

I am looking for someone who is: intelligent, funny, witty, understands sarcasm, open minded, non-judgemental, dirty minded, drama free (although venting is allowed), easy to talk with, and just fun. 

Again not looking to meet or change anyone's relationship, just looking for fun conversations to get through the day or night. 

Hope you are having a great day and I'm looking forward to chatting with you!

title: Hippy/Hipster Family of 5 new to S/SW
text:
I'm 33, mama's 34, and we have 3 young girls (ages 5, 3, and 1, the pic is 2+ years old). We live in Portland, but I've accepted a job in South Park, and I am looking to meet people, get to know South & West Seattle, & scout a place for my fam to join me, come June. I keep bees, chickens & fruit trees at our home here in Portland, and I am passionate about eating good food, eclectic music, healthy living & my kids.

We met playing Ultimate frisbee and love all manner of outdoor adventure, we'd enjoy introducing the kiddos to more climbing indoor & out. I was a stay@home parent for four years we have a van, but prefer a lifestyle where we go weeks not using it for kid transport. I am in the marine field & mama is in the birthing arts. In the summer, we line dry our laundry, picnic and find water to recreate on. We buy food in bulk and try to DIY everything at least once. I soak/sprout, ferment and dehydrate foods. The kids and I are vegetarian, I like to read about dietary & health topics, and we aspire to sustainable Traditional/SCD/Whole30 cuisine at home.

We'd love another "larger" fam to hang with who has similar life pursuits in S/SW Seattle. I am also looking for a place to stay between 27th/Mar and end of May, if you know of a temp rental, see my cl ad# 5481106589

title: Looking for my Bestie?
text:
As time goes I feel as if I will never have a best friend because I never have the time to have only one friend to share life with while laughing about dumb things or going out to watch a movie or even a casual "date" with. Saying this doesn't mean I don't have friends because I do, I have a lot of friends but not a best friend for sometime now. I been so consumed with school and work worrying about my future I forgot to live in the present. I been putting friends aside for the longest time. I get along with girls the best and having a girl best friend does not mean I want sex. No just someone that can grow on me and share our time together as friends I'm not in a rush to be in relationship but as time goes who knows.

title: I'm Bad With Titles...
text:
I honestly can't think of a good title, so if you read through this and it's not for you, please- no emails about how I wasted your time. 

I'll try my best to describe what I'd like, but I think the right person will understand. First of all, I"m not looking to meet. Where I am is not particularly relevant, but let's just say it's way too far for a meeting, even if I was interested. Basically, I'm looking for conversations that are outside our daily lives, the stuff you wouldn't normally voice out loud. This encompasses so many things, which I'm not going to list, but let's just say I speak my mind, No topic is off limits or "too soon" if it's funny. 

For the most part, I miss laughing. I had an on-line friend for about two years, and we used to have a lot of these weird conversations- and about our daily lives too- but I mostly miss those random, uninhibited thoughts that showed me who he really was. That's my take on it anyway- most of what we show the world on a daily basis is the version of "us" that is socially acceptable. I'd like to find someone who accepts me even if it doesn't always sound safe or sane. I'd like to do the same for you.

If you think this is for you, please feel free to introduce yourself, and include the same stats I've listed about myself in this ad. Oh, two things: 1) Please be a decent writer, who will write more than two sentences of "text speak". I will not respond to one- two line emails, or retarded questions like "Are you real?"; 2) Please have time to write more than once in a blue moon. I think once a day is reasonable, given all the responsibilities we have at home and work. It could be more on some days, but if you expect frequent emails every day, I'm not the one.

Finally, please don't be offended if I don't respond. It's not personal, it's Craigslist. In any case, thank you for taking the time to read my ad.

title: Eccentric loner with chronic illness looking for a friend
text:
Hey there, Im really finicky with people in general, I literally talk to two people in person in my life, my gf and best friend. I keep trying to make a second friend but its really hard for me. I hate most people, I dont get along with them nor care for more friends really, but its hard feeling so shut off from the world sometimes. I also seem to attract a lot of sociopathic people, And im extremly sick of them, so if youve been called one, please dont bother me. Ive tried having compassion for them because thats considered a disorder, but im done doing that and feeling bad for people who get off on fucking other peoples lives over, my empathy is far better used on people who arent the REASON the world is so fucked up I dont even leave my house unless I have to. 

Anyways, I tend to rant about the shit world a lot, I live with chronic illness- I have a connective tissue disorder so some days are harder to get around then others, but I can do cool tricks like the bendy pics in this post ha. Also have schizoaffective disorder which makes me a bit extra paranoid of people and reclusive. Im an artist.. I feel like Im writing an ad for a dog with issues or somehting ha. I dont know how to communicate with people on the "socially acceptable level" The whole hi how are you?- oh Fine you? - I hate idle chatter and how we all just go through these shit fucking motions in life, never really tapping into eachother on a human being level. Im not a robot, and I feel like nearly every person I talk to in public are just empty shells on autopilot, its creepy and reminds me why I almost never bother to seek any other people in my life out. 
Anywhat, preferably Id like someone around my age- though I usually get along with way older people a ton better, I think id be more nervous to met someone whos like 70 online ha. In person I see to get along with them better then most shit nose young people. I may be eccentric and look like that type of person, but Ive been told by even my own family that Im like an old man about things. Ha and then I even sometimes use a walker hahaha, Im not your average person lets just say.

title: Too Good of a Friend?
text:
I'm always there for friends, and I've been known to answer the phone in the middle of the night. I'm a great listener and enjoy helping people navigate through tough times and love celebrating the good times. I don't miss events that are important to close friends and sometimes acquaintances. But it seems that things don't always go both ways. I know who the reliable people are and of course they are a high priority, but sometimes I just help too much when maybe I shouldn't.

Of course the obvious answer is to keep being there for people and know when to cut people off. But it it gets old sometimes, right? 

Anyway, tell me what you think. What's on your mind? And if you have something completely unrelated and need to talk, I enjoy listening. I just can't put my number on here because I'd get some strange calls from CL people, I'm sure. And no, I'm not ugly :P

title: Cofounder with high drive and fin/acc/banking education/experience
text:
I'm a tech professional with high drive in a top tech company in the area. I'll launch my/our new tech business over the next 1 year. I'd like to enter the trillion dollar fin-tech industry, where I'd like to leverage technology to build no-nonsense, convenient, and fast product/service. As a consumer/customer of this industry, I have pain points, and I know there are millions of others who feel the same. So, I'd like to solve problems of millions of consumers like me and as a result ...

For the next 6-18 months, I'll develop this product side by side of my current job. If you are employed right now, you can do the same.

For a successful business, I believe the partners need to complement each other. I'm good with numbers, plus I can build very good technological solution, but I lack background in finance, banking, and accounting. So, my ideal partner will be someone who is experienced in this industry, either with corporate customers, or individual consumers. You will be the face of the business as well, and I'll manage the back-end solution and product. You'll need to shape the product/service as well, because I know HOW, but I need you to tell me WHAT to do and not to do.

This is not a get rich easy scheme or anything. This is the get rich quick with hard work based on a solid product or service, by identifying a customer need and fulfilling it with exceptional quality, customer service, and superb marketing, and branding, and scaling it for millions of people leveraging technology. If you have the finance/accounting background you should be able to easily envision how rich can you get.

I'm also in corporate employee at this moment. Both you and I know that corporate job will award you with 1-2% raise on top of your 50-150K per year salary, for your hard work of 70 hours/week. So, I'd like us to channel the energy to our own venture which can easily earn 50-150K per month.

I'm also NOT looking for any investment (not even a single penny) from your part. Just bring in your charisma, experience, expertise, high drive, passion, hunger, desire, and of course humor :)

I look forward to hearing from you :)

Cheers!

title: Friends? Puppy playdates?
text:
My name's Myfi! 

I'm a bit afraid of meeting new people, but I'm very friendly once I'm given the chance to get comfortable, I love to bake (and I will shunt many food-gifts upon you if you'll let me), I love tea , movies and animals(this includes reptiles. I own two. Be not afraid). 

I am generally relatively low-energy due to being out of shape and various other reasons, but if you have ideas for things to do I'm up for a fair amount of things! I am very blunt and fairly snarky, but I am an excellent listener and if you need someone to talk to about ANYTHING, I will sit and be a shoulder to lean on and will give generally sage advice upon being asked. I do have a long-term dedicated partner and we tend to spend our weekends together, so all of my free time is during the day (8am to 4pm) during the week. I also have the added benefit of having an adorable puppy who is SUPER high-energy and looking for routine playmates!

I do not drive, so relative closeness or a willingness to drive to me is wonderful, though I am equally content to make phone-friends or online friends! 

I'm not christian or religious and as long as you don't try to convert me I have no issues!
I am very libertarian and pro gun, so gun control supporters probably shouldn't apply. I'm incredibly prickly about being able to protect myself and equalize the playing field, as weak as I am physically.
I love all music except for rap. When I say all music, I mean everything from rock to metal to electronic to classical and opera to jazz and swing to disney music. As long as it's not Let It Go we'll get along great. I'm a bit of a budding audiophile as well!

I have a massive appreciation of nature which is a little ironic being that I've not been able to get out in it anywhere near as much as I'd like. 

The only thing I partake of to any degree is alcohol, and I'm insanely picky about it. I don't particularly have issues with anything you may or may not do, with the preference that if it's something illicit you not do it around me! I'm fine with pot smokers as well, but I ask it not be smoked around me(at least in an area where I would get the smell on me) as my partner is very sensitive and it would cause him to have severe nosebleeds :)

I'm told that I am a very giving and wonderful friend by what few I have scattered across the states and other countries! I'm fine with platonic snuggles and the like if and once you are(because who doesn't like to dogpile during movies, right? Especially when there's a cute pup!)

I mostly dream of raising tons of adorable baby animals, from reptiles to birds to mammals to insects! I am also obsessed with aircraft and many of the other Nicer Things With Engines that exist. Physics is good shit.

title: Just a friend / nothing more
text:
So I work 6 days a week from 4am to 11pm. Off on Monday's only. Don't have much of a life as you can imagine. I've been doing this for so long that I've forgotten what it was to sit and chat with a lady. Yes what I'm looking for is a LADY, no I'm not interested in sex just harmless chat over coffee, dinner or a glass of wine. Some days I get lucky and can leave work early, and it usually happens when I'm anxious about something and needing someone to talk to. I've noticed that because of my schedule that over the years I've lost all of my friends and can't find anyone to chat with. This makes life very lonely. 

A bit about myself, I'm a workaholic as you probably figured out. I'm well traveled and love the arts. I'm 48 and I'm not much of an athlete but I'm 6' tall and 198 lbs. , I don't think I'm overweight but I'm not a twig either. I think they call it HWP on CL. So if you are interested in some evening chat, maybe a movie, dinner, wine, coffee or the like, drop me a line. BTW anything we do is my treat. It's a cultural thing so don't think because I pick up the check I want anything more than a nice evening with a nice lady. I don't care how old you are just be between 25 and 55. 

Thanks for taking the time to read this and happy life to all.

title: Sleepless on the Internet
text:
Let's just say, if I knew what I was really looking for, maybe I wouldn't be looking for it here. 

With that out of the way, for now I'd like to find someone interested in chatting via e-mail, with the potential to move over to Kik. Not looking to trade phone numbers, pictures, or personal e-mails right off the bat. I'm not in Seattle, so the possibility of meeting up is pretty slim.

I'm interested in things that will keep the conversation moving. I like the standard stuff: movies, music, television, travel. I like to read, but don't do it much. If I'm gaming, it's more likely to be retro (Sorry, UNO, Pictionary, Balderdash) than current (Halo, Bioshock, WoW - that's still a thing, right?). Yes, I'm in my 30s and yes, I still love the 80s. (Meaning the decade...not specifically octogenarians.)

I enjoy writing. I enjoy flirting. I enjoy analyzing other people's problems more than my own. If you've got a dirty mind, that makes two of us.

I'd prefer chatting with men 30-50 who have a strong grasp on grammar and the English language (sorry, it's the only language in which I am fluent), who aren't going to push for pics or cam, who have a versatile sense of humor, and who are creative...but not afraid of science and math. (Okay, a little afraid of math is understandable.) I'm willing to be flexible on some of those things more than others.

If you're still reading this and feel like striking up a conversation, go ahead! Just put your name (or whatever you want me to call you) and your age in the subject so I know you're at least a highly functional A.I.

P.S. I'm not actually sleepless. If I don't reply to you immediately, I might be passed out somewhere. Oh, and if you're someone who has a hang-up about talking to chicks who may (or may not, I don't know how much pizza you eat) weigh more than you, don't bother. I am one of those "BBW" gals.

title: I could really use some good friends
text:
PLEASE DON'T RESPOND UNLESS YOU'RE SERIOUS ABOUT FINDING A NEW PLATONIC FRIEND. 


That being said, I am a 34 y/o lesbian, a working mom, with 2 kids, a wife and 3 adorable dogs at home. I'm pretty laid back, open, honest and love to laugh. I love the Seahawks, movies, good friends and good times, travel, karaoke, shopping...etc

You should be around my age unless you're an extremely mature younger person, and actually have time to hang out. (Which means you don't live 20+ miles away unless you're one of those people who doesn't mind the drive. I am NOT that person lol) The problem I have with current friends is that I almost never see them and my very best friends don't live close anymore. 
If I say something to you that may sound insignificant to any Joe Schmoe, but is a big deal to me, I want someone who will totally get the significance and respond appropriately.
That's not asking for much, right?
I want to share my thoughts, my retarded jokes, my hopes, my fears and all that other bestie stuff without judgement. Let's bitch about the parts of life that suck over a glass of wine...or shots of tequila, whatever seems appropriate at the time.
I want to be family we got to choose for ourselves.

Fair Warning:
I don't let people in right off the bat, I have PTSD and a little bit of social anxiety, I'm kinda shy and I prefer to email or text until I get comfortable and think a friendship would work before meeting in person. But if you can be patient and bear with me, it could be totally worth the wait.

Bonus points- 
You have minimal drama
You're LGBT (I could REALLY use more gay friends!)
Seahawks fan
420 doesn't bother you 
You're a parent

None of these are deal breakers, except the awesome part ;)

title: I Don't Use Alcohol As A Social Lubricant
text:
Realization has came; I need higher quality friends. 

It's easy for me to go out to a venue at night, and meet some cool new people, but lately, I haven't found the time for it, meaning I'm more focused on making money than meeting potentially cool new people. 

Also, I don't like the chaos of some night venues (aka Capitol Hill), and running into some of the frequent, up tight, scarcity ridden, basic bitch/basic dude, jack holes. I made that up. Jack holes, sounds like Asshole, but I subconsciously combined Jackass and Asshole, since there's plenty of that to go around. 

Close to a decade back (7 years ago or so), I used Strictly Platonic and only one straight guy replied to me, and he kept rambling about Julius Caesar and how being a public servant was a privilege and if enemies are at the gate, it's great to serve and protect people. Then my memory hit, he's using lines from the motherfucking Batman Dark Knight Joker movie, preaching it like its his own belief, when dude hasn't even seen war. Dude must've really loved Harvey Dent. 

-_-

I'm not opposed to being friends with gay dudes, but to be honest, I don't feel like I have much in common with them, but more so with straight dudes. And to be fair, I probably have more in common with straight/lesbian women than I do with gay dudes, despite opposite gender positioning. 

Let's cut to the chase, I've been weighing on reasons why tonight I need to have less contact with another friend and the pros of not talking to him outweigh the cons, so I made the decision to only hit the dude up maybe once every 3-4 weeks. Yes, it's that bad.

Then it made me realize what sort of people I want in my life and me knowing what I have to offer.
So here's the damn list:

Future Friend Reference Qualifications:

Has to be socially attuned, this means they know how one dresses shows social intelligence, which means not dressing like a retard/full blown D&D nerd. 



Has to not be BASIC aka Basic Bitch, or AKA Basic Bro, good redeeming qualities that differentiate him/her from the rest of the pack. I don't care to hear about your sorority/frat pack shit or mindless chatter. I want something deeper and meaningful, existential and long term goals for both of us that makes us more than what we currently are. 



Exemplify The Quality of Their Gender/Sex. --- If you're a woman that means being feminine and can cook a mean breakfast, or can turn the on switch when necessary to be feminine such as speaking smoothly and eloquently. And if a man, then being masculine, knowing when it's time to be a man's man, like fixing your flat tire, shooting guns/bows with arrows/hunting or switching out the damn car battery. 



Has To Know/Be Aware of Red Pill Truth/Reality/Social Constructs (especially race/class/etc.) & Benefit of the Nuclear Family Structure. - You know third wave feminism is a construct designed for first world privileged people to be even more privileged. As a person of color, it's the next progression of privilege to another party when a certain party already has privilege because of them being the dominant race in America. 

Also it helps if you know the current cultural landscape/history of colored folks and their struggles, from Black to Latino to Asian to Native. You watch shows Black-Ish/Fresh Off The Boat and you UNDERSTAND the Humor and APPRECIATE IT. I don't want to befriend someone who doesn't know these things and has no compassion/understanding toward what's really happening to people in reality like un-armed Black males being killed. To me, you're a BASIC BITCH/BRO if you don't know this shit or can't even empathize with this situation. 


Has To Have Connections or Be Able to Build Connections/Have Good Interactions with others. - This one's self explanatory. The saying goes, you move quicker alone, but you go farther with others at your side. I'm quite capable of this. Making good connections requires basic rapport and also screening, which is obviously what I'm doing in this post. This means spotting business opportunities and advantageous social connections. 




Has To Know How To Make Good Money or Have Good Money So They Don't Skimp Out On You & Hoard All For Themselves. Good Friends Tend To Be Generous and Encourage You To Become A Generous, Kind Human Being As Well In Return. Paying It Forward. 


-Basically, you're the average of your 5 closest friends. You've ever been friends with a broke ass person who has poor money management skills and doesn't respect the power of a dollar? They're pretty dumb right (and make poor life choices)? I don't want my close friends to be broke, otherwise we can't learn how to make money from each other and prosper together. Also if you're friends are money makers, it encourages you to step your game up too all the time. And if something happens to one another, we always have each others' backs, not just take, take, take, but give when someone has an accidental slip up. 

We're generous when giving to each other in the time of need and using those resources wisely and effectively, and not recklessly and stupidly. Example; you're going through a bullshit lawsuit and I have money to help you out while your finances are tied up, I'd help you out in a heart beat and you repay me a year or 2 later back if/whenever I'm ever in a tough spot. 

Can't Be Pushy/Selfish Or Push Their Agenda If They Haven't Made It Themselves or You Feel Is Harming You/Your Energy.

---You can't give me advice and have me accept it if I didn't want it in the first place or if it's only helping you or is from your own agenda or bias and for your own ego. It has to come from a place of true understanding, such as what would you do yourself if you were in their exact shoes. Like if you liked your smoothies to taste a certain way, I wouldn't tell you to alter it if it only fits to my taste in my smoothies, and you yourself find it disgusting. 

Has To Care About Similar Things As You Or Can/Is Willing Care About Similar Things As You. 

This one is pretty damn self-explanatory. Also, I'm a person of aesthetics, and care about my health. Even if I'm not the guy fucking you, I very much prefer not to be in the presence of someone who is obese, male or female. I find it repulsive when I'm near someone fat/out of shape and I hear them struggling to breathe for air and when they sit down on a bench next to me, it's like a fucking mini-earthquake that just occurred. 


So if you're not a Basic Bitch, and you don't get your panties in a bunch from street lingo, or if you grew up in the projects and you know what's truly real and genuine (or you're just a genuine person in general), then feel free to hit me up, especially if a lot of points I mentioned in this post vibe with you.

There's a lot of snake, two faced Libras out there, and I ain't one of them. I'll tell you to your face what it is, and I expect the same. And if someone cuts us off while we're rolling in traffic, I'll yell in their face after I pull up next to them, and hand them their ass if they're asking for it, courtesy mutual combat law of Washington State. 

I'll also delete your post if I think it's spam. Better write our sign in the subject line or NOT SPAM, or it'll be deleted. 

Also random notes about me:

I cook a mean mango curry chicken.

I make crazy smoothies.

I'm involved in design/e-commerce.

I can sing pretty well.

I can hold an E note.

I love Keanu Reeves, even though his acting isn't the best. I feel an affinity with the dude, not in a gay way either.

I can crack you up at awkward times.

I have a wide taste in music, and I can name all the artists I do listen to.

title: just hanging out...
text:
(alright, lemme try this again. . .)

So, just thought I'd try this out. . ...
I moved here a little more than a year ago, got a job, and walked/drove around a bit, but still haven't made any friends in all that time. The solitude, though convenient for the most part, does take it's toll. Truth be told, I'm not much of a social person, hard to get to know at first, and chances are I'll probably flake out of meeting people who respond to this. But when I do end up making friends, I'm pretty loyal. 

About me: 35; straight; work full-time in construction; love binge-watching tv and movie marathons; love watching stand-up comedy. I HATE working out, BUT I do it anyway occasionally just to keep from getting injured (I'm at that age where everything is starting to 'crack'); read books/comics; not much of a gamer (last system i had was sega genesis); occasional drinker; 420-friendly. . .though I don't personally partake much cuz it's not allowed in my apartment and all it does is make me hungry, plus i save money for other stuff; NOT tech-saavy at all, and i guess my big thing WAS music. . ..haven't played for years, but before that, I was into a lot of metal and punk music, but I lost touch with it. Now i listen to a lot of podcasts. 

Stuff I'd like to do/get back into (but always find excuses not to): hike, rock climb, and other outdoor adventures; drive around more (still trying to figure seattle out, let alone washington); was an avid archer before i moved here; starting to dabble in martial arts; hoping to get back into drawing and art a little more; i'd like to play drums and guitar again, not professionally, but just to jam (i used to play mostly for hard rock and metal bands, but i like all kinds of music), if you have a set of drums and want free drum lessons i'm your guy. would like to learn violin and/or banjo among others, would like to learn another language, and eventually travel more. . .

i dunno. All this is theoretical. Honestly, I'm really a 'whatever' kind of guy. I'm not super pro or anti anything. I'm not 'PC'. In actuality, I'm pretty lazy/easy-going, and as much as i like to THINK about discovering new things and blah, blah, blah. . .I really just like to hang out. Just don't preach to me or be creepy or be a dick, i guess. Again, i'm not very social, and can be hard to get to know at first, so don't take it personally if I don't respond to you. I tend to be weary of people, especially on the internet (as I imagine any sane person should). Btw, I can't stress enough that I am absolutely NOT looking for a hook up/romantic relationship. Just a friend. Hell, if all you wanna do is chat or text on the phone, that's cool too. Thanks.

title: Anyone willing to give me a chance
text:
I'm just here looking for friends right now. I am currently paying off a debt to society so I can put my past behind me and move forward. I'm looking for positive people to be around, better company than I have in here and more productive than the company from my past. I'm just your average dude, despite my current situation. I'm currently incarcerated in Washington state but will be released next year finally!

I'm divorced with kids, riding out the last few months of this bid. I have never done time before now, and I never plan to do time again. This life isn't for me. I've learned so much since I went down for this, and I'll be more than happy to share the details of my situation if you'll allow me the chance to speak to you.

My friend is managing this page for me, so know that the person you respond to is speaking on my behalf. I'd love to call you, just have a casual conversation. Take a chance ladies, you won't regret getting to know me. P.S. The phone call would be 100% free to you, it's my dime. So what's up, inbox me!

Thanks for reading! :)-

title: Not sure what I'm looking for
text:
so here I am, posting to this site, haha.. not sure what I'm looking for, maybe a new friend? maybe more? I was with someone I thought was going to be my forever, and after 5 years, I guess she had different feelings towards that.. I never had any doubt, so my whole future was based around her.. I still blame myself for all the what ifs,.. it's hard. I haven't attempted dating or anything for over a year now.. To be honest, I'm lonely. I miss just feeling close to someone, I miss the sense of touch the most... 

I want a friend first and foremost, someone to catch a movie with, watch stupid TV with, go on weekend road trips with, get out and explore new things with each other wine and beer tastings, maybe smoke a bowl and watch a new pixar movie or slasher flick lol... what ever happens I don't want to be in a rush.. 

little bit about me, white male 36, could loose a few lbs before summer, so I guess I need to get on that. .6 foot 4, I currently have a full beard, I usually don't, but willing to shave it off for the right lady if she asks me nicely. haha... I am self employed for over 15 years now, I'm a super casual laid back easy going. . no children, just a bunch of nieces and nephews.. I come from a big Mormon family, my parents are still married after almost 50 years. . I look at what they have and know I want the same. . I just hope it's not to late for me.. 

love my blue apron meals and cooking, classic cars and trucks, anything that makes me laugh, love stand up.. History and exploring, Mt rainier to the beach.. 

anyways, if you feel like we might click, write me, send me a picture and maybe I'll send you one back, no picture till I get one. . it seems like this is haw it works, oh, and I really don't know what all these abbreviations are, so be blunt with me.. lol

good luck

title: Lucky 2016
text:
Well, I've been trying to get my money back out of an extra ticket I've got to no avail so I've decided to go the charitable-ish route instead. I've opted to trade it for company lol. 

Me and my cousin will be heading down a little early on Saturday, just looking for someone fun and energetic who wants to ride along and do a little pregaming at the bar beforehand. Not looking for any favors or pervy shit like that, just a high energy person to get amped up with before the show. Once we get inside you are free to keep hanging out or ditch us and find some other people to run with.

We will be staying at the Marriott up the street so you can either line up a ride home that night or crash back at the hotel. It's a queen suite so if you decide to stay there's a foldout bed in the living room, no having to cuddle up to a stranger unless you wanna lol.

Now, there's only three stipulations to this offer. 
1) be between 21-26 years old. 
2) be a sociable, energetic person. 
3) be 420 friendly. Actually, you don't even have to smoke. Just don't take issue with it if I do.

Also, we intend to roll at the show so if you plan on hanging out just know that will be happening.

Well, think that's about all I've got to say on the matter. Shoot me an email with a picture, a little about yourself, and any other questions you might have. If you sound like a good match I will respond in kind. Oh yeah and change the subject to the artist you're most excited to see.

title: Looking for queer friends in Tacoma
text:
I moved to Tacoma from Seattle in December, and now that my home base is largely stable, I'm redirecting some energy into trying to build a queer friend network down south. Say hi if you're in Pierce county, especially north Tacoma!

Some stuff about me:
I'm 27, cis [she/her or singular 'they' pronouns], queer [largely attracted to hard femmes, androgyny & masculinity], femme-identified, polyamorous [currently 1 live-in partner + 1 comet partner, open to dating], child-free [& don't want any], multi-medium artist, self-employed small business owner, empath & HSP, energy worker [reiki], proud SJW, cat lady, out since age 14. Some hobbies include travel, photography, writing, coffee, meditation, thrifting, writing sarcastic things on the internet, smoking a bowl and having soul-enriching conversations. I'm not really into small talk; I'd much rather honor authenticity and get to know you as a person, not play games.
I work from home, so while getting out and seeing the city is important to me, I'd also love to eventually find people I could hang out with often and invite over during the day for coffee dates, study hall [meaning: we both work but occasionally chat], hangouts, & whatever. Since we might meet from CL first, though, we'll stick to a coffee shop.
Thanks for reading!

title: A chatty, but sincere, e-mail to my non-existant boyfreind
text:
Hey Baby,

I really missed you this weekend. I thought about you a lot for whatever reason.

I hope this finds you well and happy. Do you feel good? I hope you were not too lonely without me. What were you doing this weekend? You didn't have to work, I hope. Did you manage to get something accomplished or was it just a lazy weekend? Any good movie,good eats, did you get all rain soaked too?

Saturday,I went down to the Edmonds Goodwill, found a beautiful Patagonia jacket. It was a nice day. Stopped at PCC too, got a few goodies. Went and had my hair colored/cut. After that, went out with my brother. We did have a good time, smoked some ganja, shot a few games of pool, then down for some some Creole food. But it wasn't the same with out you there. Downright depressing having a family relation for a date, no matter how well you get along.

Sunday, did some chores, went to Costco. Made a special trip to Home Depot, where I did not find what I was looking for, which was quite irritating. And it was so stormy out. I was getting soaked just trying to run a few errands. I thought screw it, and decided to just go back home. Good decision, a warm and cozy afternoon, watching the storm from inside, after the more tactile experience from earlier. I put my fuzzy pants on, made some cookies. Watched a depressing WWI movie with Russel Crowe, then John Oliver, and such. I love watching JO make fun of "Drumpf." It's a few minutes I can laugh about the whole thing, instead of feel that general sense of horror. He also did an informative rant about Special (local taxing) Districts. It was pretty interesting, they are like the "black budget" projects for the Feds, accountable to no one, only on a local taxation level. A little disturbing.

I made Petrale Sole and Artichokes for dinner. You would have loved that, I would have had so much more fun with you there to laugh and cuddle with. I am almost finished with my Bill Bryson book.

Any who, I am back to work on Monday morning, another drizzly day. Beats last year's drought conditions I guess. Like you, I have always loved the rain. I really like my new office space, and it's great having someone divert so many calls now. We will have more time to spend together. I am live streaming KEXP right now, they frown on that here, but I found a work around :). Gonna go to my Monday night work out after work tonight, then I will be back safe home again.I took a silly selfy of me right before work out the other day. I was feeling particularly vital and youthful at the time (gotta capture the moment don't always feel like that these days - ha ha). Maybe I could send it to you.

Sometimes, I just can't wait to look in your kind eyes, and see your beautiful smile.I can imagine you holding me tight, and the relief I will feel knowing you are there. I am OK by myself, but can be hard without you sometimes.These guys I have met, they are not you, so I don't even bother. Why even? - with the too young and "friends with benefits" bull shit - if it's not for reals. And because I know you have stayed faithful to me too for the same reasons. You are out there, I feel you, and it's going to be worth the time it took my love.

As Always!

Me

title: Do you still wonder?
text:
The other day I was checking stuff out on Facebook. When a picture caught my eye. It was one of those "people you may know" pictures. It took me a second before I realized I did know the woman in the picture. My high school sweetheart. Class of 19 hundred and 78. Lisa was her name, and for a nano second she once again made my heart smile. I think her dad was my age when I started dating her. He was a big man with an evil eye on me. Lol. Rightfully so. I was a senior she was a freshman. I still Remember the first time I met her. I was throwing a football around in my front yard with a friend. She was on her bike, and stopped to watch me. She was 14, I was 17. I didn't like her. Thought she was a pest and she wouldn't leave me alone. One day she even came to my house asking for me. My mom thought it was cute and says "oh he's in his room go on in" (that was a mistake lol). After awhile she seemed pretty cool. Sort of a tomboy type. We talked, started hanging out together, fishing together, making out in my 64 Chevy in my front yard, (what the hell was I thinking, oh ya I wasn't) of course we got caught. Mom didn't think she was so cute then. Lol. She was my only girlfriend in highschool, my first love, my first best friend. Unfortunately (kind of) before I met her I had already signed the line to join the Navy. She couldn't handle the long distance and I don't blame her for moving on. I mean come on we were just kids. There is a lot more to this story but I will spare you the details. One thing I know is I loved that girl. Everyone said it was just a crush, or I think I loved her. Well that was over 35 years ago. And her picture still moves me today. I was right. I did really love her. Have you ever wondered if things went differently how your life would have maybe changed. 

Here's to you Lisa. There has been and always will be a spot in my heart for you. Love always Jim.

title: Unique Housemate Opportunity
text:
Are you a writer, an artist, a composer, an actor or a business guy? Have you been looking for a private, peaceful, quiet place to live and work?

Consider sharing a mostly-furnished "mature mansion" perched on the water's edge, on Bainbridge Island. Look across the Sound at Seattle, watch the ferries go by, yell at the gulls and herons, and walk on the beach (low tide). You would have your own upstairs (large) bedroom with adjoining bathroom. You would have access to a downstairs great room (with tv, wifi and music), a fully equipped chef's kitchen and an old-fashioned sun room, with perfect light for painting, drawing or working. A piano could even be arranged. Large outside deck is one of the greatest places to enjoy a Bainbridge summer. Street parking. Ten minutes from downtown Winslow and the ferry terminal. Kitsap Transit commuter bus passes right by the house.

I am a local single guy and have lived alone on the property for four years, established connections on the Island for twenty. I am making some serious career/life changes which are limiting me from covering the monthly rent and expenses without some help. I would be looking for $1100 per month to cover your portion of the rent and shared utilities (water/garbage, electricity, fuel oil, tv/wifi, no house landline phone). You'd only need to buy your food and drink.

I am seeking a single, established, financially secure/responsible professional, whose life circumstances would make such a situation attractive. No cigarettes. No pets. I'd prefer at least a three month commitment, and could agree to month-to-month beyond that.

Please respond and tell me why this situation might be good for you. We can arrange to talk on the phone or meet face-to-face to discuss this opportunity in more detail. Personal and financial references will be required.

title: The long, lost, forgotten art of email exchange
text:
Oh, hello there. I'm Canadian and live about 14 hours away from you, let's get that out of the way right off the bat. [Insert an "everyone moving to Canada if Trump is elected" joke] I totally lied and put a random Seattle zip code - but I'm only looking for a pen pal of sorts, not trying to cheat the system.

I might be a little old fashioned but I still enjoy crafting emails and receiving them. It's almost like this practice has been relegated to the same sphere as smoke signals, carrier pigeons and telegrams [outside of necessary work email communication]. Anyone I personally correspond with on a regular basis reaches me through more instant messaging means. There is definitely something to be said about that immediate feedback but there's also a satisfaction that comes with giving and receiving a well thought out message, however short, in email form. I'm not asking for novels here, I'm asking for random musings from absolute strangers, knowing that a person has decided to dedicate a small portion of their time to share their thoughts with me. Need an outlet for something? Plug into me. I just realized how sexual that sounded but I'm going to leave it there for comedic value.

title: Gonna give this a chance....
text:
I'm 31, have a job, all that fun stuff....I'm just looking for a cool chick, who likes video games, likes rock music, can handle anime on occasion, and might enjoy smoking green every blue moon. I know, tall order. Lol.

I'm also not entirely sure what I'm looking for. I have a 6 year old little girl, who is the most amazing thing that I have ever been given in life....she's my whole world.

I'm only saying these things because I believe in honesty, being open, and never bsing someone. Is this drama? A little. Is it drama like the baby momma drama a lot of people have? Nope.

I just want, as I said, a cool chick to talk to, get to know, and maybe hang out with....and if things progressed, cool, if not, whatever. However, unfortunately, looks are somewhat important if things were to progress, I'm not really into the ebony or BBW girls....just a preference. For friends however, I'm down with anything. Lol. If you're married, have a boyfriend, live at home, I don't care....I would just appreciate some conversation, maybe some flirting if that's what happens, and who knows, lets just play it by ear?

With your reply, please put your favorite animal in the subject line, and if you'd like, include a pic of you and I'll send one back in my reply. I sincerely hope to hear from someone, though I'm honestly not going to hold my breath...lol, I'd probably die. XD

Also, I am not down for a lot of crazy bs. I've had some responses that were from some really interesting people that I had to part ways with.

title: seeking a friend
text:
Howdy, hopefully you have had a fine day as I have, to this point. For whatever reason you are reading this, maybe something here will pique your interest :) I'm Aaron and currently on vacation to Seattle from South Dakota. 26 years old, I am Native American, about 6'2 with short hair and gauges. I play guitar and seek a spiritual path in life, what does spiriruality mean to you? Right now I am doing my best to use the force and go with the flow. It's my first time out of the Midwest though and I have no friends in Seattle. I have had a great time wandering and exploring within the downtown area on my own, plus the hostel I am staying in has great people but something is missing. Maybe just the feeling of a long cruise around the area, seeing the views and enjoying the sound together. I would love a long conversation filled with passionate dialect and intellectual stimulation. Let me make you laugh and feel comfortable with yourself while we spend time getting to know one another. I am a true empath and so there is never an awkward moment with me, awkward silence is not my middle name. I enjoy science fiction and philosophy but also good cannabis with beer on occasion. Studying is a passion of mine, so maybe I am a nerd but it can't be a bad thing that I am more keen on who was chosen to take the acting mantle of Peter Parker than whichever candidate wins the presidential election. If anything I said sounds appealing then please, I implore you to send me a reaponse! This is my first vacation and I would love a friend to help me make it perfect. Who knows, maybe even romantic? Anyway, I cannot wait to hear back from whoever you are.

Love Always,
Aaron

Facebook.com/evoVI89

title: Judgement free friendship

If this sounds like you then perhaps we could befriend each other? I won't judge you and you won't judge me. Wherever you come from in life is okay with me. 

I am looking for someone to talk to, spend time with, someone with whom to find distraction from the status-quo. 

Reply via craigslist email. Tell me why you need a friend. Tell me about what holds you back (your demons) and I tell you what holds me back (my demons). Your pic gets mine. I also don't want to be in charge of this so tell me what you want/expect from me. 



P.S. I've never done this before and have no idea what to expect :/

title: Lets chat about the Craigslist Experience itself?:-)
text:
Well, I'm on CL to find something specific but this post is not about that. 

This one is to discuss the craigslist experience itself!

Its good and bad - aint it?

Bad coz I check my inbox too often, read useless posts and respond to people who are never to write to me!


Good coz its thrilling - the excitement of waiting for a good response to your post or even better the excitement of getting the next message from someone you hit it off with. That adrenalin rush is so damn cool! 

Its like a whole world in itself.

Any of you want to just chat about that? If yes send me an email with "Craigslist" in the subject.

I'm 30, sensible etc - dunno if it matters but putting it out there anyway!

title: Goddess of the Odd (Untitled 6)
text:
Look at my flaws: I judge people by their writing. I'm easily bored. I'm vain. I have a thousand half-finished projects. I fear that, after I die, I will have left nothing of consequence in the world. It seems I also have an imperfect commitment to monogamy, at least in my imagination if not in practice. I also don't believe in sin.

And yet: I am smart, and sometimes funny. I am frequently a good listener, and almost always a good friend. I love a wide range of improbable things, books about Japanese dystopias and giant lawn flamingos and costume jewelry and videogames and big dogs and poetry disguised as song lyrics, and a thousand thousand other things. I am imperfect, wondrous and flawed.

Both side of me are evenly odd.

(I took the title and last line from Kendrick Lamar, because it's a freaking awesome song. If you think this is any good, you should go listen to it.)

title: Does Anyone Know Where To Find Friends?
text:
My name is Aleshanee. (Al-eh-shaw-knee)

I'm into yoga; I go to the Yoga Loft and I am studying to get my certification in yoga instruction. 

I love music. I love listening to and discovering new music. New genres, new bands, whatever. I just love taking it all in. I especially love music made by my friends. I love to see the people I love expressing themselves through their art. To me there's no better way to get to know a person. I love local shows, and the harder and faster the better. There's little I find more enjoyable than being surrounded by sweaty aggressive kids rocking out to awesome music. The whole experience is just kind of what life is about to me.

I am a terrible artist. Like, stick figure bad. But I like to paint, and I love to see other people's art. My favorite artist is Salvador Dali, because I love his dual meanings, and how much weirder he got as he got older. I love museums, street art, tattoos, everything. I love it all. 

I love to read, in fact I spend more time reading than pretty much anything else because I'm usually really fucking bored. I love being transported into different worlds and realities, and coming away with a new perspective on life.

I LOVE to dance. I am strength-training myself to get back into ballet to re-learn some technique so that I can return to my true love, contemporary. 

I am also training to be an aerialist! I have my own ropes and everything. 

I have a career in the cannabis industry, I've been steadily working over the last year and have a ridiculous amount of information on the history, culture, medicinal applications, and legislature of cannabis. 

I am awkward, like, hopelessly awkward, but in an endearing way. I am passionate about life, I love to help people I care about, I am very bad though, at making friends. I don't talk very much, and it takes awhile to get to know me.

I can't seem to meet anyone who I can keep a connection with. We all need friends, you can't just go through life all on your own without sustaining considerable damage to your psyche. 

So if you'd like a funny, kind, creative, blue-haired, pot smoking gal who rarely speaks to be friends with, here I am. I'm willing to give all you weirdos a try. Unless you're creepy, or just not very nice. Then fuck you.

title: Lets trade massage
text:
Update: I've posted before, but only to have people flake out. I have no idea why it's so hard to find someone willing to give as well as get a massage. You can go second so you get the most time and a better experience if you like. It's a rainy, grey day. Let's try and have a little relaxation. Nothing more is expected.

Hello,

I'll keep this short and sweet. I doubt it will go anywhere anyway.

I am single, fit and have a nice home in Silverdale. I have a massage table and give an amazing rub! I work out regularly and also like to stay very active. 

Not only do I love to give massage, once in a while I would love to get one! I hate paying for them as I think sometimes the best are between friends who aren't watching the clock and who will listen when I give them direction on what feels good. Honestly I have had problems with both when paying.

So, we can be friends who enjoy each others company and conversation, or we can just be two people who need a nice, no pressure massage. 

Not to sound like a jerk, but I do want a massage. Not to rub on you for over an hour, hop on the table and after 5 minutes of light passes of the hands, have you say you're tired. Nor do I want to get up and have you grab my privates and think that's all I'm there for.

Don't worry if you're inexperienced or don't think you have the hand strength. I can teach you what to do and how to use your weight to do the work without hardly any stress to you at all. How do you think professionals do this all day every day?

If you are interested in this, I would love to hear from you. We can chat a bit, meet somewhere public and safe for us both and see how we click. Honestly, I would love a massage today if you're up for it!

Thanks for reading and take care,

title: Happy Hour - 10 a.m.!
text:
Hi.

Join me for a morning drink!

I work nights, and around 10 a.m. have a glass of red wine to slow myself down a bit and get to sleep for my next night shift.

I am tired of doing this alone.

I would like to pour another glass for an average-sized local lady who can join me for a drink at this time without adversely affecting her schedule or life. I'll happily serve you a glass of my current cabernet, or pour you the drink of your choice.

Cheese, crackers, grapes, avocado - all entirely feasible.

If you are a talker, we can talk. If not, we can turn on Netflix and see what's new. I am not trying to slink my way into a date - if I want to do that, I'll be up front about it. I'm really not looking for that now. This is truly about no longer needlessly spending this time of day alone. 

I am a very well employed, tidy, clean, decent-looking guy (descriptors which fit my home, as well) and am asking for you to pen a quick sentence or two about yourself, and a pic if you are interested. I know there must be a lady out there who wouldn't mind joining me for a free, mid-morning drink.

title: Personal Trainer offering private/small group sessions
text:
Hello!
My name is Ryan and I'm a personal trainer trying to build my own, local client base.

I've been personally working out and passionate about health, physical fitness, and working with others in pursuit of their goals for over 11 years!

After working with friends for a few years, I decided this was a career path I really enjoyed and wanted to follow after. 
I've earned my certification and am now ready to start helping you change your life!

I specialize in weights/cardio/kickboxing/mma, much more geared to fun, applicable workouts to burn fat and build muscle quickly.

While I take an observant approach to help determine your current states and goals, I'm a very involved trainer and will do the workout right next to and with you.

I'm listing several ads, trying all I can to get myself out and help others.

Please, don't flag my ads, competition is good for us all.

I want to and am passionate about empowering people to take control of their lives.

My workouts are fun, exciting, effective, and I'm excited to meet and help you realize your goals!

Please feel free to reach me by phone or text, email is also acceptable.
I have an open schedule due to training full time so 24hr gyms and schedules are even doable for night shift people wanting to improve.

My prices are extremely fair and I'm always willing to work with groups on price or buying a few sessions at once.
