- If you plan to involve me in your infidelity. I pride myself on being loyal and trustworthy. If you have ANY intentions of being more than friends, I am NOT the person for you. 
- If you wanna go on and on about your baby momma drama or relationship bullshit. (Now.. let me clarify, if you're having a hard time with a fight or something, I will absolutely support you, but there's a difference between that and a CONSTANTLY unstable and toxic relationship. Know the difference). 
- If you want someone to get plastered with. I DO NOT drink or want any part in it. 
- You are judgmental and not okay with all types of people and dynamics. 

PLEASE DO email me if -
- You want a truthful, positive, long lasting, drama free, friendship.
- You want someone to game or color with.
- You want someone to get coffee with, watch netflix with, or cook/bake with. 
- You are okay with kiddos and or have some of your own.
- You want puppy play dates. 
- You love to laugh and want to laugh so hard your sides hurt. 
- You want someone to drive around with blasting tunes and annoy people. lol
- You are accepting of all people. 
- You are an adult and know how to handle a real friendship. 

If you're still interested, please send me an email. I can send my kik or number. I'm a total textaholic. :) Have a wonderful rest of your week and thanks for reading. :D

title: Platonic only - yes, I hope these relationships still exist...
text: Hey, thanks for clicking on my post. Hopefully this is the first step in making a new friend.. Unfortunately, my work and school schedules are crazy Monday - Thursday, so I'm hoping this will be a good way to meet some new, cool people. BTW, crazy weather we're having?!?! Should be nicer starting tomorrow (Tuesday). So, I know that this Craig's List and this section isn't really for platonic friends anymore; it used to be but I guess not so much now. However, I still have faith that there are still people out there, like myself, that are just looking for friends. Ok, I moved out here a few years back and I make some really good platonic friends on here back then. Unfortunately, they've either moved away to Ballard (you know some place so far away that they refuse to leave their new The Shire to come back to visit the old one) or they actually moved away (out of the area). Again just to be clear, I'm truly just looking for platonic friends to do stuff with. Absolutely no funny business. Period. I'm a laid back, non-smoking, educated, progressive, "lefty", black guy looking to expand my circle. Bottom line, I'm just looking for friends who would be up for grabbing a drink sometime, going to movies, running/jogging, soccer/flag football, working out, hiking, rock climbing and talking. Good conversation is essential; being able to discuss issues [and solutions] in technology, the environment, world events/affairs, non-commerical media, politics (again I'm a proud, educated progressive but very respectful of differing views). I know that's a crazy laundry list, but I'm truly open to meeting new, non-flaky people. If any of this sounds interesting and you're not a flake, please feel free to email me back. Thank you again for clicking and reading. I look forward to melting through the freeze and making some new friends.

title: Where did the passion go
text:
Are you a woman who is trapped in a circumstances of necessity? Do you feel invisible to your lover, unfulfilled and unappreciated? Who are you? You are of no particular age, body style or ethnicity. You do however have a positive outlook, the desire to be wanted and needed. You live for the anticipation, the craving and adoration that you richly deserve, and you sweetly and willingly give that and more in return.

title: that that we were is no more
text:
the day you told me was the last day of a week of foot pounding back snapping work.
i came home you had a bottle and poured drinks knowing i would need sedation.
it was an unusual welcoming, a remnant of our hot sensual, early days.
we slowed down the drinking and the sweltering nights of love
the last few years were all work buying this house.
your face was flat, long, serious. i felt an earthquake rising.
all the rejected bone tired nights of interest in only sleep
floated before my mind's eye painting a picture of our love.
with your impatience to go to a fresh love
you were to tell me 
that that we were is no more.

And... as the system has pretty much taken away hopes of retirement and further made reliant on the system which continues to eat every dollar, there isn't much leverage for expensive treatments on the far and distant fringe of FDA approval. Death will come sooner.

So, foraging field guides out there, please recognize my pursuit-- really this is about company, education, and doing good on behalf of someone, to hopefully relieve the pressures of doctors, care-givers, therapists, and everyone involved. title: Fishing,Hiking, R1200GS Riding, M4M Only Please
text:
M4M, Only Please,,,,
Interested in meeting gay men that enjoy fishing, boating, the outdoors if they exist :)
Straight guys are always welcome too.
I am looking for a platonic gay male companion/friendship for fishing (serious yet fun), hiking ( fun and moderate), Motorcycling (safe and fun), snowshoeing(fun moderate), boating (Puget Sound). A local gym buddy (Stanwood) would be great too.
I am an avid fisherman, hunter, outdoorsman, and motorcyclist. 
I retired in '15 (Natural Resources) so have much more time to enjoy the outdoors. I'm in pretty good shape(5'09",215#) thanks to a 30 year career working in the outdoors.

My husband (30's) and I (50's) are easy going, educated,professional, masculine, gay men.
We are not guys whose being gay is obvious. (Being Descriptive of us-Not judgmental of others)
That said, we are well adjusted :), been together for nearly 10 years now. We enjoy meeting other gay couples for coffee or a bite to eat.
How about us getting outdoors and doing some serious fishing, or enjoying a hike or a boating excursion in the San Juans.
We put extensive miles on our motorcycles, having sold our Harleys and purchased a couple of R1200GS's (4000+ miles this summer)
Oh, and calmer water Kayaking on fresh water or salt.
We fish out of a HewesCraft 19" Extended Transom Hard Top, an awesome Puget Sound boat. We sold the river sled last year.
I/we fish the Columbia River (Astoria to Vancouver WA), Puget Sound, Baker Lake (awesome Sockeye Fishery) , and am branching out to The Potholes and Moses Lake in eastern Washington.
I'd love to learn to fish the Fraser River.

title: I cain't find mah dang spectacles!
text:
Word-weather is changin. We ain't code-switchin. I just cain't find mah spectacles. Yep, mah eyeglasses. I lost 'em. I'm just wandrin around lookin like Dr. Seuss cuz I cain't see nothin, creepin all 'round, a-peekin and a-pokin, shnerplin mah neck all weird tryin to read mah screen.

title: writing heals and helps - that's just a fact!
text:
If you're a writer, then you know that when a specific moment overwhelms you -- you just have to get the thoughts out of your head. For some of us, it's moments of sadness or loneliness -- for others the pain is so great that you have no choice but to write about it. I've been there ever since I was 12 so I know how it works. For many years I couldn't go a day without writing. It was a part of me. The pain was too deep and writing was my outlet. I guess it was time to take a break. I had mixed writing about my pain with dabbling in erotica to distract me from the pain. It worked sometimes while other times I wanted nothing to do with it. For the last 5 years or so I stopped writing. That's the longest span I've gone since I was 12. I just made a decision to stop and I did. I played the piano a bit but writing was gone - something I never thought would happen. Until. . .My health was threatened. The possibility of breast cancer was a possibility which literally came out of nowhere. I had to take a bunch of tests but ended up OK. Unfortunately, while this was happening I had to sit at the Thanksgiving table and act like life as usual when for me it wasn't. Then, in January my son fell after kicking a soccer ball and got really hurt. I don't want to get into all of that but it's been 2 months later and we are still trying to get him better. I then cut my brother out of my life -- FINALLY -- and suddenly my life was a mess. What do you think I started doing almost immediately? Write. I haven't written as much as I would have because of my extenuating circumstances but I started to write again.

Writing heals, we all know this. I've always felt better after a good write. Yet sometimes when I was sick of writing about the pain I wrote about something else, romance, or fantasy and constructed it into a short story or something like that.

Being 45 I thought this group, would be great for those around my age. We'll have more in common, I think. But again, it's not a "pre requisite".

I created a Yahoo Group called "Writing Heals" and it would be great if you would join and give it a chance. I mean, what's the worst that can happen? Maybe you can meet some other people who are going through similar situations and this group could be about healing.

The only thing I don't want to do is LIMIT the type of writing shared in this group. It could be any genre. Why start a writing group if I start limiting genres.

If you have any interest, 

email me at scarletblack0307 @ yahoo . com and I will send you the link to join. 

It would be an honor to get to know you.

Scarlet

title: Get to know me
text:
So what had happened was.... 

I pretty much dedicate myself to my work, and I hate it. But I love my day to day, I'm the business of finance where you make your own pay check so the effort you put in determines what comes back to you. 

I was hanging out with my good friend yesterday, and we have that relationship where no matter how long it's been whenever we kick it; it's like it was just yesterday we saw each other. So it's been like a couple months since we heard from each other, we were talkin and he goes, "so what do you do when you're not working?" I think long and hard, and it's like damn I really don't be doing shit. So I hit him with, "man I just relax and do laundry and run errands when I get the chance really" 

I want to change the route my life is heading towards, I'm most comfortable in a tie or in my bed. I don't find it amusing anymore to go out, that needs to change! I went out to Ruth's Chris the other night, me and two other of my good friends were sat by this group of hot suburban housewives and I didn't say anything or try to create conversation! 

I'm looking to get to know everything about you, tell you my side. I just really want to get to know someone, and see where it goes. Friends, friends with benefits, girlfriend, wherever it goes! 

Don't be shy, I never had much in life so I know better than to judge somebody. I got blessed and had the opportunity to make something of my life, after many and many of times I messed up. I will never take anything for granted, cause anything could happen between now and the next day. 

I don't know why there's robots on here, but I'm real Doug Baldwin and Russell Wilson both just got engaged.

title: Friends?
text:
I am in my 30s, but I am pretty open to all ages... just as long as looking at you doesn't make me feel old. ;)
I don't have kids, but it's cool if you do. Just don't bring them to anything. (This is a joke too, but two wink emoticons seemed excessive in the first two lines).
I am partnered long term, but he's not really into socializing... so you will mostly just get me. I don't mind hanging out with couples or single people though.
Mostly I am looking for another woman or a small group of women who want to get together and just chat over drinks or dinner. It would be great to see live music (from The Tractor to the Symphony) or go to events like the Fremont Moisture Festival (it's coming up soon!). 
I am pretty mellow though I can get fired up about politics and tend not to keep my opinion to myself. But... I try to make up for that by being a good listener.
It's hard to shock me unless it comes to the mistreatment of others and/or bigotry, in which case, be on your way! 
I get along best with people who are direct, honest, open-minded, and caring. I also love people who are into traveling and/or talking about traveling.
Downtown Seattle or the surrounding areas would be best for me (like Queen Anne, Capitol Hill, Ballard, Fremont, Wallingford, Magnolia, Greenwood, etc.). I am open to people from other areas of course, if you don't mind coming in to the city. I am just not much of a driver.

title: Get Out & Live Life
text:
I'm a full-time grad student and single mom. I just finished an internship and I'm staying with family and taking more than a full course load to finish early. I'm on a student's budget and only have a little free time, but if I don't do something for myself I think I'm going to go crazy! When your kid tells you that you need a life because you work too hard you know you need to do something. Lol. Unfortunately since I'm not working and my program is all online it's hard to meet people, so here I am. 

I am looking for a man because we usually have more similar interests. I'm very upfront and honest. Not interested in FWB, or a casual physical relationship. **Please be close to my age, fit so we can be active together, and Kitsap County only**

I don't hang out in bars and rarely drink, so I want to find someone adventurous. Who will go to a rave one weekend, and the Seattle Symphony the next, then hang gliding, maybe jump out a plane, zip-lining, the shooting range (I don't own a gun, wish I did), try archery, go kayaking, play pool at the seediest biker bar we can find, wander down random ally ways in Seattle to see where that "one" door goes, hike in the Olympics .... The only thing that's ever held me back from doing what I want is money and time. I have taken every opportunity life has presented me. 

I have trust issues and being short and small doesn't help. It will take me a little time to get to know you in public places before we go wandering off into the woods together.

If you're interested change the subject line to the area you live in.

title: Looking for a Friendly Friend!
text:
Hey there =)

I'm looking to make a FRIEND somewhere in the eastside of Seattle. I like going on walks, chatting, watching good movies, cooking, baking, working in my yard, BBQs, snowboarding, playing sports, watching sports, and crafting! I don't drink or smoke, and I dislike weed. If you drink or smoke weed, that's cool. . .just not around me. I love animals, nature, and writing. I'm not much a traveler. I love too many things about where I live and who I am around now to want to leave. I recently started going to the gun range with my husband, and I really like it. They always have ladies nights, so it'd be fun to go with a gal and shoot! I've always wanted to go fishing. Maybe we could do those!? I am one of those people that gives hugs and not handshakes. I'm very loyal and honest. I don't like extremes -- political, religious, health, etc. I fall into the middle of most categories and I don't like arguing much! I'd rather laugh than bicker =D I also like eating. If you don't like food...we probably won't click.

My favorite color is green. I have two dogs. I still like cats. I'm pale and have long brown hair. I like mashed potatoes and steak. I love soccer. Aaaaaand I love being creative! Why buy something in the store when you can make it at home for three times as much! story of my life...

I'm looking for someone who is friendly and understanding, and who doesn't want to text for ten years before we meet up. I want to hang out =) in person is so much better. I don't care if you're black, pink, white, green, or orange. . ..as long as you're a girl. If you're a fan of Hillary Clinton, however, we won't get along =) 

If I sound like your kind of girl, give me a shout! 

Cheers =) and happy searching!

title: And now, for something completely different... - m4mw
text:
So here's the thing: I am trying to get out into the world as much as possible. My close friends moved away to different parts of the country, and the ones in the area have been so busy with their own lives. I too have been kept busy with work and school, but things are beginning to settle, and I have a feeling that it would be nice to meet new people. Who does not like making new friends?

I am pretty open-minded, love movies, and I am getting back into reading regularly. I'm finishing up my undergraduate degree, where I'm an economics/philosophy/political science major. Running is something I am re-learning to do (I was previously an avid runner), and I am training for a couple 5Ks. I savor the experience of food, especially Thai, where I cannot resist a good plate of pad see ew or pad kee mao. I'm learning to cook and I like comic books, so I have a few geeky moments.

I enjoy witty banter, have hobbies, and genuinely ask questions, so conversation will never be short.

title: Friends? Puppy playdates?
text:
My name's Myfi! 

I'm a bit afraid of meeting new people, but I'm very friendly once I'm given the chance to get comfortable, I love to bake (and I will shunt many food-gifts upon you if you'll let me), I love tea , movies and animals(this includes reptiles. I own two. Be not afraid). 

I am generally relatively low-energy due to being out of shape and various other reasons, but if you have ideas for things to do I'm up for a fair amount of things! I am very blunt and fairly snarky, but I am an excellent listener and if you need someone to talk to about ANYTHING, I will sit and be a shoulder to lean on and will give generally sage advice upon being asked. I do have a long-term dedicated partner and we tend to spend our weekends together, so all of my free time is during the day (8am to 4pm) during the week. I also have the added benefit of having an adorable puppy who is SUPER high-energy and looking for routine playmates!

I do not drive, so relative closeness or a willingness to drive to me is wonderful, though I am equally content to make phone-friends or online friends! 

I'm not christian or religious and as long as you don't try to convert me I have no issues!
I am very libertarian and pro gun, so gun control supporters probably shouldn't apply. I'm incredibly prickly about being able to protect myself and equalize the playing field, as weak as I am physically.
I love all music except for rap. When I say all music, I mean everything from rock to metal to electronic to classical and opera to jazz and swing to disney music. As long as it's not Let It Go we'll get along great. I'm a bit of a budding audiophile as well!

I have a massive appreciation of nature which is a little ironic being that I've not been able to get out in it anywhere near as much as I'd like. 

The only thing I partake of to any degree is alcohol, and I'm insanely picky about it. I don't particularly have issues with anything you may or may not do, with the preference that if it's something illicit you not do it around me! I'm fine with pot smokers as well, but I ask it not be smoked around me(at least in an area where I would get the smell on me) as my partner is very sensitive and it would cause him to have severe nosebleeds :)

I'm told that I am a very giving and wonderful friend by what few I have scattered across the states and other countries! I'm fine with platonic snuggles and the like if and once you are(because who doesn't like to dogpile during movies, right? Especially when there's a cute pup!)

I mostly dream of raising tons of adorable baby animals, from reptiles to birds to mammals to insects! I am also obsessed with aircraft and many of the other Nicer Things With Engines that exist. Physics is good shit.

title: Opinion wanted
text:
I'm seriously contemplating separation/divorce. We've been married for most of our adult lives, but there's no longer any intimacy. My wife says she still loves me, and will always show love in other ways, (meals, gifts, quality time) but can't bring herself to be intimate with me any longer due to past mistakes I've made that she can't seem to get over. I feel lonely and hopeless. 

Is it wrong of me for wanting to leave the marriage due to lack of physical touch, even though she loves me in other ways? Does that make me a self centered person for wanting to be desired in that way? Does that make me a typical male creep? Nobody is accusing me of that (yet), but I wonder how it will be perceived by other friends/family if I tell them that lack of intimacy is my main reason for leaving.

What are your thoughts?

title: Work Out/Activities/Friend Stuff
text:
HI,
Yep, I have resorted to Craigslist! I have found myself looking for new friends, Work out Buddy, Someone to do fun things with. The current "Friends" I have, well, I am not into the drama or being put on the back burner ALL THE TIME. That is not what friends do.

So, I am working on myself to become healthier and more fit, I am Happily Married and Straight. I am Caucasian. I do not care the color of your skin, You Sexual Preference, The color of your hair, Your age (within reason) or the type of car you drive. I am not looking for anything other than a Friend or two or Three or .... I am looking for friends. That is it. 
I am a Mom of two grown girls and an incredible special needs 8 year old son. I am looking for that or those friends that have kids or don't have kids. I am 50 years old, However I believe that is just a number, because I surely do not feel I am 50. I really enjoy certain 5K's 10K's and half marathons NO I am not excellent at it. I am just challenging myself. Last year I did at least one 5K a month, and LOVED being active. I am now pushing myself with 10K's and Halves this year. I am not saying you have to, I just want to know I have a friend that supports that. I am looking for that someone who wants to feel Fabulous and Fit and wants to have an Honest to Goodness TRUE/REAL Friendship. 
IF I have not scared you off by now, Please if you are serious, then respond, but if you are not, and just looking for a quickie, Keep on going. I am 100% happily married, and only wanting a TRUE Friendship. 
Thanks for looking Have a Fantastic Day!!!

We have done fairly well for ourselves building what we can with what we have, and we live pretty healthy, motivated, happy lives as simply as we can. There are a lot of skills, and projects at work on our property, but we are lacking help, and people to share the outcomes with..
We are interested in meeting someone, or possible a few people that want to get away from the city and garden, or need some space to breathe the trees into your lungs. title: Looking for new friends to visit
text:
In just a few short weeks, I'll be visiting Seattle and while it won't be my first visit to the city, I'm wanting to expand my circle of friends in the area. If a friendship can start, great. If not, that's fine, too - this is just one way to meet people. 

Who am I? A college-educated lady who just turned 40 recently, though many will say I look younger than that, who spends her days working in a stressful office environment and looks forwards to evenings that could hold a variety of activities, all with the purpose to forget the workday until the next one has to start. Some nights, it's some form of visual entertainment with a glass of wine and perhaps conversation, if there's someone next to me. My tastes in movies and TV are in the action/adventure and sci-fi/fantasy areas, the same can be said for the books I enjoy most. Another night could be out somewhere that music and dancing takes the stage, something that isn't easy to do when you don't know the neighborhood. A few hours at a local museum or tourist attraction would not be unusual, either - there's much out there that I have yet to see or experience. 


Who am I looking for? The short answer is just to meet people who share any interests I have. The complicated answer . . . There needs to be some level of intelligence - I took the time to write this ad, your reply should reflect that you took the time to write, as in using words in sentences. There also needs to be patience - I do not live attached to my electronics, so it could take a few hours (yes, really, I do mean hours) for me to read your email and reply. Trust from me is something that comes in bits and pieces, which is another reason for patience - I've had too many bad experiences from rushing. Also, I will be very direct: I find myself more comfortable with men than women, but I do give everyone an equal chance. 

That's all for now - if you're still reading, thanks for your time and I wish you all the best in your search for whatever it is you're looking for.

title: Friends only...well with some snuggling
text: Let's face it, at our age, there are a lot of us whose body parts aren't cooperating. My knees are killing me:-( And due to a drug given to my mother during her pregnancy with me, my intimate parts don't work correctly anymore. It has stopped me from posting in the romantic section. But I miss male companionship and affection. We both just see our malfunctioning body parts as a natural part of the aging process of life instead of a loss, and neither one of us is going to let that stop us from having a close, loving, fun, long-term relationship. I'm 63 years of age, 5' 5", divorced, have waste long brown hair, a few more pounds than I would like (but not obese), very healthy (no high blood pressure, no high cholesterol, no diabetes). Things that I like to do: I love live shows of all kinds (plays, comedy, opera, concerts, restaurants with live music, etc.), science (especially archaeology, and astronomy), museums, the beach, Sunday afternoon trips, cozy warm snuggling by the fire, cuddling while watching a movie, good wine, ethnic restaurants and dancing. Hoping to spend some of the winter months in Hawaii or Arizona in three years when I retire. Want to visit Egypt and Italy, and would love to explore the U.S. in an RV someday (I especially love the Southwest). I am happy, secure and independent. I love going out with my friends and won't give that up, but miss the companionship and affection of a man. Most importantly, we both love to laugh! If you think you want to try to make me laugh, tell me something about yourself and send me a photo. I will send you a photo and more about myself, if I think there will be a connection (no photo, no reply). PLEASE no drugs, no alcoholics, no diseases, no smoking and have employment or a secure retirement. PLEASE live within 30 minutes of Lynnwood and be between 59 and 68. You may think I am very picky, but I like my life, so I am just looking for someone who will make it a little better.

title: Introverted Nerdy Mom
text:
Hi everyone! 

I've posted a while back when I first moved here, but no one really clicked with me so I'm trying again. I'm from Orange County, CA and just moved here last month because my husband's best friend lives here and we wanted to move somewhere new. I'm starting to notice that WA people don't care for CA people moving here unless it's for Army related reasons lol. I do adore CA with a passion, but I swear I'm not here to steal jobs or talk hours on end about how amazing CA is compared to here. :p

Back on topic, I'm looking for a few friends to become close with. As stated, I'm a pretty big introvert so big parties and whatnot aren't really my thing. I'm hoping to find someone chill who can have fun just binge watching Friends and eating an insane amount of cookies. title: Asian female visiting at the end of May!
text:
Myer Briggs stated that I was ESFJ. I can most definitely agree that I am an extrovert. I honestly don't like to be stereotyped, categorized, or labeled [like how I'm Asian and I'm suppose to be *suuuuuuuper* smart with *almond-shaped eyes*]. Although I am full Asian, I'm pretty Americanized - English being my primary language, Vietnamese a second [yes, I'm fluent for those who are curious], and sarcasm/ebonics being a third [if you get offended because of this statement, then we can't be friends]. I would consider myself educated (learnt everything from Barney, Big Bird, and Bill Nye the Science Guy). I'm employed (if you count being a stripper and trap queen as employment), and I like to workout (and by working out, I mean lifting any utensils with food on it to my mouth). I find myself funny from time to time. 

On a serious note, I do workout about 4-5 days a week. I despise cardio, but do understand that it's a necessary evil. I love to lift! My squat/deadlift/bench are currently sitting at 215/260/135 for working sets of 5x5. 

I find that my happy place is in the kitchen. I use to hella count my macros, but I've gotten to a point where now I'm pretty good at eye-ing it and guesstimating. I know; cool story bro. I bake and sell cakes as a side hustle on top of my 9-5, so you know I'm pretty legit. I enjoy experimenting with food and see what other clean eats I can come up with other than eating the typical chicken titties and veggies. 

I'm looking for a friendship where we can get to know each other. I would definitely not be opposed to more if the sparks are there, but only time will tell. It's not about so much if you complete my list of standards, but more so the connection that I feel when we talk with each other. If you're a looker, that's a plus but it's not what always matters. I'm also confident in my personality and what I can bring to the table. I have always enjoyed getting to know people, their history, culture, values, morals, etc. 

As for education because apparently it matters to some people, I have a bachelors of science in biomedical sciences and a master of science in healthcare management. 

I'm not going to lie; it bothers me a lot when people do not get their homonyms right. It's just a pet peeve and an automatic turn-off for me. I'm also not into dirty talk, so sorry not sorry, but you're gonna have to get your Asian-fantasy fix somewhere else. 

If you've made it down this far, you might as well message me because *something* must have caught your eye. :)

title: Looking for Eastern Asian Male to hang out with for the weekend
text:
I will be in Seattle 4/8-4/10. I have a friend that is supposed to meet me there but his work may not let him go. So I am looking for someone in case he can't go. I know this is a long shot, but I was hoping to get to know the potential person first so that if my friend can't go, I will have someone to hang out with that I'm comfortable with. 

I am looking for a male of Eastern Asian descent to hang out with. Japanese, Chinese, Korean, Vietnamese, Thai, etc. I'll be completely honest--I'm unhappily married and this is one of my rare chances to go away by myself and have fun. My friend is a hot Asian and if I have to replace him...I'd like to replace him with another hot Asian. This will just be a platonic weekend, NO SEX, but I want to have as much fun as possible. I want to flirt, I want to feel pretty, I want harmless sparks. I want a bit of joy that I lack in my day to day life. 

The itinerary: I have tickets to Shen Yun. If you don't know what it is, please look it up. They're decent seats. While I'm in Seattle, I want to go to Shen Yun, the Chihuly museum, I want to eat really good Asian food, maybe go to the zoo, Pike place, and anywhere else you think might be fun to go to. I've been to Seattle, but I don't really know my way around. The music museum might be fun too...I've never been there. Chihuly is a must tho. And I will spend hours there. Hours. So you need to like these things, if not love them. Shen Yun will be paid for, everything else will be on your dime for your half. I'm not looking for an Escort, I'm looking for a cute friend. I'm looking for someone I get along with to spend the entire weekend. From breakfast until I go to sleep at night. And I won't have a car so you'll be driving everywhere. :D

A bit about me...this is where things get real. >.< I'm short, fat, and kinda cute-ish. I'm also really hard on myself. Lol. For real tho, I'm 5 feet tall, 197 pounds, white as F***. I love to laugh, I'm a blast to be around, but I can be annoying as hell. I'm honest, I tell it like it is, and I don't like games. I get attached to people easily so ideally we'd still be friends after this. Like I said...it may not happen but ummm...maybe my friendship is at least worth a shot? >.< 

You...Eastern Asian. Patient. Fun. Able to laugh at yourself. 28-45 years old. Don't be a prick and be courteous. Shen Yun is cocktail attire so you must have something to wear that fits this category. Don't ask me what, google it like I did. I don't usually go to shit like this but it's because I have nobody to go with, not because I don't want to. I'm really excited to go so please just be a decent guy. >.<

The reason I ask for Eastern Asians is because that is what I'm attracted to. Yes, it's just platonic. But I will be hanging out with you for a weekend and I would like there to be chemistry. Fun friend chemistry. Also, I like to talk with people about their background and culture and this gives us something to talk about. So if you're Asian but hate talking about Asian things...please don't reply. Oh! And if you have tattoos...plus. ^_^ But don't worry if you don't have any...lol.

If after all the mess above, you might be crazy enough to be interested, please 
1. reply with Shen Yun in the subject line. 
2. Include a pic of yourself. If I'm interested, I'll reply with a pic of myself. Then we can hop on one foot, cross our eyes, and continue the odd dance that is CL personals. 
3. Tell me why you're interested
4. Tell me one (or more) random facts about yourself.

If you don't hear from me 1) I may not be interested. Sometimes I get a lot of replies and I hate wasting people's time. 2) I may have a lot of replies to sift through. If you want a reply whether I'm interested or not, please let me know. A simple 'Please let me know if you're not interested, no harm done' will suffice. Trust me...If I'm interested you did not win the lottery. I'm not that great. Lol. So if I'm not interested...it's really no loss on your part. Please don't get upset. It doesn't mean you're any less of a man or unattractive. We just don't click. And just because I respond with a pic doesn't necessarily mean we'll get along either. Umm...I think that's it. Thanks for reading!!!

title: You'll probably fall in love with me...
text:
Hey there! Perhaps my ad title was a bit obnoxious, but I am just giving you a fair warning and should you proceed any further into this note, you do so at your own peril :) Okay maybe you won't fall in love with me, but I feel fairly certain that you will at least "like like" me (read that as though you were in the 5th grade and you're asking your friend Margaret "you know does he like like me?") or at the very very least I am certain I can make you smile and laugh. Oh and this is the platonic section so you shouldn't be here looking for love anyway!

What makes me so charming? God seriously I am not an arrogant ass, I am just trying to have some fun. Oh and my therapist told me to be more confident...okay teasing. About me...well I am reasonably intelligent, I am considered attractive in some circles, I have a real job, I don't live with my mother, and I am one heck of a great listener. And isn't that last attribute what helps to make a good friend? I have a pretty wide array of interests, I know great jokes, I write incredibly sexy short stories, I am kind to animals, and just yesterday I purposely went out of my way to help out a guy who generally bugs the shit out of me.

My shortcomings? Well of course I have some. I have a penchant for using the "F" word, but my New Year's resolution is to minimize that, I get distracted by attractive women in church and I end up missing part of the sermon, I am very unkind to bugs who scare me, but much like saying Fuck too much, I plan to re-visit my relationship with these scary bugs. I ramble, like incessantly, like I mean I can go on and on about virtually nothing, like take it apart and look at it from 7 angles and still have really said nothing...see?

Why do you care about any of this? Frankly I have no idea, I mean you're the one still reading this. But if you want a new friend and you can look past my shortcomings (a couple I failed to mention...I am flirty, I am sassy) well then we should talk. You can reply here or if you're feeling really adventurous you can send me a message on KIK, my username is warmancheery. I hope to hear from you!

title: Ladies, let's talk about something...
text:
I'm only posting this just to get some feedback from women on here (and men if they would like to add their input).

Ladies, I want to know something. Originally, I'm not from Seattle. I hear a lot of women in this City complaining about how most of the men here don't have the balls too confront them when shown interest. "Men here are awkward, timid, etc", these are just a handful of what I hear when I ask women about their experiences when it comes to dating. I'm aware that everyone's experience are different.

As a man, I have been told by some men that they would rather do things other than putting time, energy, and sometimes money on dates when there's a possibility that it may not work out in the end. 

In my opinion, consider men and women two heads of the same coin. I feel like both genders are afraid to waste time and other resources on something that may not last long enough, but like kids, some of us tend to point our fingers and blame the opposite gender.

I could continue, but I don't want to go on and on. I just enjoy studying and researching when it comes to human behavior and other things related to this kind of stuff.

title: Moving to Washington
text: Hello, I am a cynical, disenfranchised young man living in New Orleans, and I seek to move to Washington because of your cheap college, clean energy alternatives, plethora of tech jobs, legal marijuana, and agreeable climate. I am tremendously depressed and I feel like the change of pace might do me good. The difference between mellow and stagnant should get my wheels turning again. So, about me, I am a writer, an artist of sorts, I am practicing at two instruments and have interest in learning another two, but I wouldn't say I could play them. I like b movies, cartoons that are disturbingly deep for children's programming, I am saving up for more tattoos, and a new laptop, I play traditionally geeky tabletop games like dungeons and dragons and magic the gathering, I smoke pot on account of my being a nervous wreck and a slightly agoraphobic misanthrope, I like mellow music, I dress all in black if I can help it, and I despise children but I feel like someday I might want to raise some anyway. I like to walk around on clear nights and sit out in park space or woodsy clearings and stargaze, I am a futurist, I also believe in magic and the paranormal and supernatural and whathaveyou, it's the only field I would truly enjoy studying, but journalism and computers work too, I am spiritual but not religious, I don't sleep very much, and I want to start a text message correspondence with someone my age who lives in Washington so I can at least say I know one person who lives there, and hear about a slice of life and how it all works up there. I can tell you all about New Orleans, and I am also a great friend over text messages. Not so good at speaking, but I can type brilliant soliloquies with a thumbpad. It will be good to make some new friends, as my current friends are unkind, unsupportive, and as rotten as I feel to say it, they are just holding me back and using me. It is an unhealthy environment, so I am going north west and chasing my dreams with a fistful of dollars and two bags of worldly belongings. My lease is up in June, which is when I imtemd to head up, once my affairs are in order. Send me an email telling me about yourself and I will send you my phone number.

title: New CDer for new friends.

I should state clearly that I am not looking for a "hook-up" or any other sort of sexual encounter. Receipt of inappropriate photos, innuendos, or advances are not welcome, and will not be received well.

I am more interested in meeting a fellow CDer or a trans person who's been down this path and can lend me a hand in presenting as female. NO SECRECY - if you're attached, it would be best if they knew because I'd hate for them to think we're fucking (because we're not and we won't). text:
Intelligent, educated, professional, WM with a truly wicked sense of humor and a flair for the erotic, seeks an e-buddy to build synergy and to resonate with.

I get bored as hell at work because I do the same thing over and over. Sometimes the only thing that keeps me out of the loony bin is chatting it up...texting, email, IM, talking on the phone...Hell it could be smoke signals (no, not THAT kind of smoke), carrier pigeons, or bongo drums and I'd still enjoy it.

What I'm looking for is to make a connection...To have that spark happen when intelligent conversation and flirting are mixed together with the rush of meeting somebody new. BOOM! Explosive?...Oh hell yes! I love it!

So then what happens, you ask. Well, I'm seperated and I'm definitely not looking to change anybody's situation while I figure out mine. I'm really not expecting that we hook up, date, or even meet for an ice cream sundae at a church social (I've never done it in a church, lol...Have you?). At the end of the day, I'm just hoping to find a gal pal who both enjoys some male attention and giving a guy that same attention. Anything beyond that...let's cross that bridge if we ever get to it.

So let's talk about you: A woman (sorry guys, nothing personal, I just don't swing that way), 40-60 (the age is just a suggestion because we're likely to have more in common...but if you're under 40 or over 60 and you think you're up for the challenge, then by all means). Race, looks, religion, occupation, politics, astrological sign, blood type, favorite football team, etc etc are unimportant. Marital status...that's an interesting one. I prefer you to be married or divorced...But, as with the age, if you think you're up for it, then by all means.

Turn On's:
A.) A woman who has a sense of humor as warped and irreverent as mine (You can laugh at almost anything).

B.) A woman who doesn't need me to carry the conversation all the time (aka isn't afraid to speak her mind).

C.) A woman with something going on upstairs (aka you know what synergy and resonance mean...or at least you're motivated enough to crack the dictionary).

D.) You're a fan of flirting and being flirted with. If you DON'T, let's not waste each others time.

Turn Off's:
A:) If you're somebody who thinks that bored people are boring, then carry your ass, sister. You're probably a princess and I dont need the headache.

B.) Likewise if you're going to be offended by my self confidence and think it's arrogance or conceit. If that's offensive or threatening, keep moving. There's plenty of gals who like self confidence in a man.

C.) Ditto on preaching about morality. If I want a lecture, I'll go to the aforementioned church and try that ice cream sundae.

D.) Nit Pickers. See A, Princess types for details. I'm not here to try and fix what's wrong with anybody and I sure don't need somebody doing it to me.

The rest of you gals, crack that dictionary, look up synergy, and drop me a line ;)

title: Platonic only
text: Hey, thanks for clicking on my post. Hopefully this is the first step in making a new friend.. Unfortunately, my work and school schedules are crazy Monday - Thursday, so I'm hoping this will be a good way to meet some new, cool people. BTW, crazy weather we're having?!?! So, I know that this Craig's List and this section isn't really for platonic friends anymore; it used to be but I guess not so much now. However, I still have faith that there are still people out there, like myself, that are just looking for friends. Ok, I moved out here a few years back and I make some really good platonic friends on here back then. Unfortunately, they've either moved away to Ballard (you know some place so far away that they refuse to leave their new The Shire to come back to visit the old one) or they actually moved away (out of the area). Again just to be clear, I'm truly just looking for platonic friends to do stuff with. Absolutely no funny business. Period. I'm a laid back, non-smoking, educated, progressive, "lefty", black guy looking to expand my circle. Bottom line, I'm just looking for friends who would be up for grabbing a drink sometime, going to movies, running/jogging, soccer/flag football, working out, hiking, rock climbing and talking. Good conversation is essential; being able to discuss issues [and solutions] in technology, the environment, world events/affairs, non-commerical media, politics (again I'm a proud, educated progressive but very respectful of differing views). title: ISO Clandestine Married Book Babe
text:
Imagine spending 2016 engaged in a reading challenge with a married stranger from another state. We each commit to reading at least one book a month. You read whatever you want, I read whatever I want. We share our book reviews with each other. 

We might find that we have similar interests, or we might find that our interests are worlds apart. Either way, we'll motivate each other to stay on our "book a month" pace and will learn new things along the way about each other and the books we're reading. Think of it as a flirtatious long distance anonymous reading affair. Safe and harmless, but enriching and adventurous at the same time.

title: Looking for someone to take walks with non smoking/drinking etc.
text:
I'm 44 and just looking for someone who may enjoy walking at the beach, or along the Tacoma Waterfront, or Maybe Point Defiance. I have a dog who likes to swim and is afraid of everything that sounds like a Boom. She is my companion mostly, and with me almost always.
I do not go out to bars or clubs. I don't drink, smoke or do any drugs, prefer you are about the same- but I know that's a lot to ask- so just be aware of my personal preference- If you smoke or drink, I just do not want to be tempted I just got over all that. TY. I used to 420- so honestly, prefer NOT to be around it because it may be too tempting. Free from all drugs, including tobacco, for recently, about 2 months, and 4 months, before that. So somewhat just over the habits, and not desiring to go back. therefore prefer the same- not judging if you do- just do not want to fall back. 
Just a guy, who needs a friend sometimes, that likes walks, talks and maybe someone who love rocks and minerals a great plus. Pic for pic.
No I do not have a 9-5. I have hobbies, occasionally do yard work, for someone and fuel and things I need like dog food is about what is covered. Maybe some cash for get a coffee or something? This sounds pretty lame- I know but understand- I am no fat wallet guy- I think I want to sell my rock collection or publish a book- I just scrape by- not even a care really- except to find more friends I can just be friends with for now- sometimes I am sure I am going to get back up, and live- it seems I am looking for peace within, and then all will come together- I am generally happy and easy going. I have my ups and downs- (writing a book here).
Coffee is my only stronghold left. So if you love coffee then maybe do coffee and take a walk, in Tacoma- I am reserved, and have a few favorite places. If interested send an e-mail. 
I am in a place in my life where, a change may be inevitable. But still trying to hold onto what I got- and that may seem like little. I have a vehicle- but am not independently wealthy- nor otherwise with a lot of funds. That's why I am asking for a walking or chill out partner. Your place- ok. My place not. 
If still interested mention Opal in your post- my birthstone. Blessings and safe journeys, no matter what.
Always open to new adventures. I am outdoorsy, I know where to find cool stones rocks and minerals, in Washington- I want someone who could do activities with that sometimes includes digging in the dirt for Quartz crystals, and Amethyst, etc. That's really my favorite passion- :) , and my life is rather boring otherwise? it seems- on the computer too much maybe?
. I don't take any 'meds' for anything. Probably no one ever typed such a long deal. And well I only hope to meet someone great, who wants to meet a great guy for adventure, movies, walks, talks, chat, etc. See where this goes. My first one of these and well- May it work out better than I may be expecting- Opal- In your reply. Thank you.
I'm an Oct. 28, Scorpio(n) if that helps :) born at 7:55A.M. and love poetry, my dog, And been in a LTR- so really just seeking a friend at this time. Spontaneous, did I say that? :) Namaste'.
kids, want: no- i have one, all grown.
personality: Outgoing, love to talk, honest, etc

title: Calm and Understanding for Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder
text:
I have severe Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder, leading to Anxiety Disorder, Depressive Disorder, and Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder. I haven't had much social activity in many years. It's quite common for me to not talk to anybody for a week or more and when I do, it's primarily to various doctors and therapists. So now I'm looking to meet some people who generally have a calm, accepting demeanor and would enjoy going out and doing simple things around town. 

I'm on a limited income, so I want to keep it inexpensive. We could maybe hit up some happy hours with cheap food (I don't drink though), or visit various exhibits - I heard there are a couple Shakespeare folios at the downtown library. There used to be lots of good local music that only cost $5-10, but my knowledge of that is several years out of date so prices may have risen. I also have a two-for-one coupon for a dance class at the Century Ballroom that might be fun eventually, except I think dancing is a bit beyond my social comfort zone right now. 

A couple of my passions are photography and the outdoors. So I would enjoy just wandering and taking pictures of the Seattle neighborhoods, or visiting some of the nice blooming parks and gardens this spring. There was a time when I went on lots of outdoor trips up into the mountains and out to the coast, but I haven't done much in recent years because I haven't had anybody to join me. I always found that going out into the serene wilderness helped me feel peaceful. I'm not into adrenaline sports and I prefer to keep both feet on the ground, but I often found myself covering 20 or more miles in a day over some rough and steep trails to reach the pristine areas that still have very little human footprint. I never did any overnight backpacking though because I never knew anybody else who wanted to try it, but that might be fun one day. 

I'm seeking friends with calm personalities who are understanding of my restrictions and social awkwardness. It would also be best if you have some physical fitness and can do the outdoorsy things I mentioned, though trips like that wouldn't come until later. I don't care about your race, religion, politics, (as long as you don't proselytize with those) or relationship status. For age, it would probably be best if you're close to me or younger. I haven't had the social experiences of other 30-somethings, and people always say I seem much younger than I am when they meet me, which I think is a polite way of saying I'm immature. So if you're willing to put up with all of this, write me an email and we can talk some more.

title: Young stay-at-home mom looking for friends
text:
Hey there I am looking for friends who are also in their 20's who either have kids or love babies and don't mind my 9-month old son tagging along :)

I love spending time outdoors and enjoy fishing and hiking and would love someone who is also wanting to spend more time outdoors. It would also be great to find someone who is comfortable just hanging out at each other's places sometimes since that is often more practical with a baby! We could talk, play video games, work on craft projects, have coffee or maybe even some cocktails or wine. I'm still wanting to lose some pregnancy weight and the apartments my husband and I live at have a workout room if you are looking for someone to workout with too. If you are married or in a relationship my husband and I are also up for double dates, and if you also have kids maybe we could do babysitting swaps for each other :)

I don't smoke but it's fine if you do, I do drink a couple of times a week. I'm Christian and my faith is an important part of my life, but it's cool if you have a different faith or none at all. I'm the kind of person who doesn't get offended if someone doesn't have the same opinions I do. It can be fun to debate things sometimes, but I think its important to be comfortable ending up at "agreeing to disagree" and still respect each other just as much! I think that's one of the most important qualities I want in friends.

When I'm just getting to know someone I think I come across as quiet and reserved because I definitely have a touch of social anxiety. Who I really am though is goofy, a bit wild, adventurous, and I care about people deeply. I find joy in simple things and am not a hard person to impress. If you think we would get along feel free to reply and I will send you a pic :)

title: Successfull, hysterical, radical, intellectual, philosophical, musical
text:
Good luck finding a more fun, interesting, open minded, easy going, creative, calmly driven, hyper-eligible and heterosexual, biped, humanoid anywhere this side of West Seattle! If you think you can, bring this alleged subject before me so I may learn his ways, or not... 
uhh... Bragging about myself is not my strong point.
Modesty is blindingly more noble than arrogance or competitiveness. 
However, I do probably need to at least explain and describe myself.
so here goes: 
I am the proud inventor of the SpiderWhistle.(c)
Spiders of every kind come 'a runnin' from all directions fast as lightning with one blow of my new and improved SpiderWhistle.(c)
IMPORTANT NOTICE: Don't forget to have plenty of SpiderChow.(c) on hand as it is NOT recommended to tease spiders. Remember that serving anything other than "SpiderChow (c)" brand Spider food may cause spiders to become aggressive toward the whistle-blower.
Children ages 3 and under "should" be supervised. 
Use caution in densely wooded, tropical areas near the equator. 
Seek medical attention immediately if / when a spider attack occurs. 

I'm a Licensed and Certified Professionalologist, but I try not to let it get to my head. 
Also a self proclaimed Intellectual Magician / Professional Musician / Freelance Comedian / Experimental Philosopher / Makeshift Psychonautical Neuropharmacologist / Perspective Expander / Love Provider & Receiver / Under-vindicated Malingerer / Emotionally Mature Subgenius / Eccentric Unobtainium Collector. 
At times I tend to become a bit compunctous in the profundity of intellectual confabulations, as my vocabulary is inexplicably breviloquent, and I have little to no comprehension whatsoever of the vast verbicullarly linguistic proclivities randomly strewn throughout the entire modern English Lexicon. In other words, I'm highly uneducated, so language is basically like, just a bunch a werds i ain evin tryin uh fill my brainz wif cuz iss too full uh poo ahready!
Oh yeah, I should probably also mention something about my "Deliberate Tourette's Syndrome" which I acquired while vacationing in Sub-Space-Zer0 via un-airborne imagi-pathogen-nation.
so, moving on...
If there's anything particular you don't enjoy about me or my ridiculous banter, PLEASE tell me, & lay it on thick too, I mean really make it sting, I can take it. lol...
Insane, how people really believe that "words can hurt". HA!
There's always room for improvement from what I've been told, but who knows... who cares, 
or not. Whuddoo eye no!
PS. Not into needing or being an emotional sponge, jealousy, control, deception, desperation, ridiculous expectation, impersonal tradition, arrogant narcissism, racism, sexism, fascism, or closed mindedness, so I guess that means I'm open to any of the above, because I'm just THAT open-minded. I'd even be down for some crazy-ass, whack'd out fetish shit that exclusively incorporated all the above, as long as we can have insane screaming arguments in public regarding the most unlikely subjects, accompanied by reverse psychology body language. 
Allow me to present a scenario;
SO FAR, THIS AD HAS ONLY ATTRACTED THE ATTENTION OF MEN, AND MEN WHO DRESS AS WOMEN, SOME VERY CONVINCINGLY, AS WELL AS STRATEGICALLY TRYING TO BAIT ME INTO HOMOSEXUAL ENCOUNTERS. I GET HIT ON BY GUYS PLENTY ON CAPITOL HILL, CAUSE I PROBABLY LOOK LIKE A BEAR, AND I FEEL FLATTERED AND HONORED AND IT'S A GREAT FEELING TO BE DESIRED, AND I WOULD TOTALLY KICKIT WITH THOSE DUDES LIKE PLATONIC STYLEE, AND BULLSHIT ABOUT BREEDERS. I CAN'T IMAGINE WHY ANYONE WOULD EVER EVEN THINK ABOUT, LET ALONE CARE ABOUT ENOUGH TO TALK ABOUT ANOTHER PERSONS SEXUALITY OR DIET OR POLITICS OR RELIGION OUTSIDE OF THEIR INTIMATE CIRCLE OF FAMILY AND FRIENDS! ALSO, I'M BEGINNING TO BELIEVE THAT ABSOLUTELY NO SINGLE CUTE FEMALES IN SEATTLE ARE WASTING TIME LOOKING FOR LOSERS ON CRAIGSLIST WHEN THEY COULD BE AT A SPORTS BAR SCORING STUD AFTER STUD. NO JUDGING IF YOU DO, I PROBABLY WOULD TOO IF DOUCHE BAGS WERE MY THANG.

title: Seeking 55+ friends closer to home - w4w or w4m
text:
I'd like to meet good people who live in Renton, south Seattle, Factoria, Newcastle, Kent and other areas within about a 15-mi. radius of Renton who are ~55 and up in age. Please be a reliable person who follows through after emailing, not so busy that you never can find time to socialize, and someone who plans to remain in the area. Thank you for reading the entire ad before replying to it with answers to the PLEASE NOTE paragraph below.

Are you looking for real, long-term, reliable friends rather than just acquaintances? I'm also ready to meet new friends closer to home who are kind and considerate to share good conversation and activities. How about you? Do you love nature and getting out into it? Art and music? Let's meet at a cafe for a conversation or get out for a park walk and chat on a good weather day and go from there.

People who are adventurous, will try new things and are curious about life in general are my favorite types of friends. My interests include almost anything that's outdoors in decent weather - good walks and hikes; having a good conversation; musical events; good movies, plants/gardening and public gardens; little road trips, and lifelong learning about all types of things including other cultures. Indoor pursuits like conversation over coffee, museums, dinner, talks, hearing music of many types and the like are great when the weather may not be cooperative. I'm hoping you share some of those interests and also want to meet someone who will share some of your unique interests and offers mutual support. I'm a non-smoker (you too, please) and occasionally have a wine or drink. We don't need any of this to have a good time, however. 

I'm a truly good person, have a sense of humor, and am a good friend who remembers birthdays, pays attention to what friends say, and tells them about news or activities I think will interest them. I'm also an empathetic person who will help friends in whatever way I can whenever I can. I'm intelligent, but not intellectual, have a spiritual side but am not religious. (No proselytizers, please) I'm reliable and look for other people who are too, as well as people who are kind, good people who have most of those qualities. Nobody is perfect, of course.

PLEASE NOTE: Please email and include where you are (city/neighborhood), a bit about your personality and interests, and days/time windows you're generally available to socialize. Please be close to the boomer age range and in the areas posted in the first paragraph above. If you'd like to send along your number in addition to a self-description to shortcut things, you can definitely trust me with it. 

If you're fit enough to get out for at least brisk walks, that would be great. I'm fairly fit for this age. I was born elsewhere, have been in the Northwest more than half a lifetime and have interest in meeting people from everywhere. If you're overly concerned with superficiality over substance, we very likely would not be compatible. Otherwise, I look forward to hearing from you soon! [Sorry, not looking to meet married people or couples. It doesn't generally work out that well.]

title: Book Club
text:
Do you like books? Do you like books so much you want to talk about those books with other people? Do you want to talk about those books with other people while also drinking coffee and eating tasty snacks? Then you should join Book Club!

Book Club is for people like you. People who love to read. People who like to chat. People looking to make new friends who also like to read and chat. We're just starting up so we're looking for founding members. If you want to be one of those members then you need to email us. Tell us briefly why you want to join book club. Tell us what kinds of books you like to read. Tell us the last book you read and if you liked it or not. Tell us what kind of availability you have and what days and times are best for you to meet. We prefer if you live in the south King County / Pierce County areas but we won't hold it against you if you come down all the way from Everett. 

Contact us soon. Don't wait. If you wait you'll miss your chance, and that would make everybody sad. 
Join Book Club. "Read. Discuss. Repeat."

title: Fishing,Hiking, R1200GS Riding, M4M Only Please
text:
M4M, Only Please,,,,
Interested in meeting gay men that enjoy fishing, boating, the outdoors if they exist :)
Straight guys are always welcome too.
I am looking for a platonic gay male companion/friendship for fishing (serious yet fun), hiking ( fun and moderate), Motorcycling (safe and fun), snowshoeing(fun moderate), boating (Puget Sound). A local gym buddy (Stanwood) would be great too.
I am an avid fisherman, hunter, outdoorsman, and motorcyclist. 
I retired in '15 (Natural Resources) so have much more time to enjoy the outdoors. I'm in pretty good shape(5'09",215#) thanks to a 30 year career working in the outdoors.

My husband (30's) and I (50's) are easy going, educated,professional, masculine, gay men.
We are not guys whose being gay is obvious. (Being Descriptive of us-Not judgmental of others)
That said, we are well adjusted :), been together for nearly 10 years now. We enjoy meeting other gay couples for coffee or a bite to eat.
How about us getting outdoors and doing some serious fishing, or enjoying a hike or a boating excursion in the San Juans.
We put extensive miles on our motorcycles, having sold our Harleys and purchased a couple of R1200GS's (4000+ miles this summer)
Oh, and calmer water Kayaking on fresh water or salt.
We fish out of a HewesCraft 19" Extended Transom Hard Top, an awesome Puget Sound boat. We sold the river sled last year.
I/we fish the Columbia River (Astoria to Vancouver WA), Puget Sound, Baker Lake (awesome Sockeye Fishery) , and am branching out to The Potholes and Moses Lake in eastern Washington.
I'd love to learn to fish the Fraser River.

title: Warped, Wicked, & Irreverent
text:
Intelligent, educated, professional, WM with a truly wicked sense of humor and a flair for the erotic, seeks an e-buddy to build synergy and to resonate with.

I get bored as hell at work because I do the same thing over and over. Sometimes the only thing that keeps me out of the loony bin is chatting it up...texting, email, IM, talking on the phone...Hell it could be smoke signals (no, not THAT kind of smoke), carrier pigeons, or bongo drums and I'd still enjoy it.

What I'm looking for is to make a connection...To have that spark happen when intelligent conversation and flirting are mixed together with the rush of meeting somebody new. BOOM! Explosive?...Oh hell yes! I love it!

So then what happens, you ask. Well, I'm seperated and I'm definitely not looking to change anybody's situation while I figure out mine. I'm really not expecting that we hook up, date, or even meet for an ice cream sundae at a church social (I've never done it in a church, lol...Have you?). At the end of the day, I'm just hoping to find a gal pal who both enjoys some male attention and giving a guy that same attention. Anything beyond that...let's cross that bridge if we ever get to it.

So let's talk about you: A woman (sorry guys, nothing personal, I just don't swing that way), 40-60 (the age is just a suggestion because we're likely to have more in common...but if you're under 40 or over 60 and you think you're up for the challenge, then by all means). Race, looks, religion, occupation, politics, astrological sign, blood type, favorite football team, etc etc are unimportant. Marital status...that's an interesting one. I prefer you to be married or divorced...But, as with the age, if you think you're up for it, then by all means.

Turn On's:
A.) A woman who has a sense of humor as warped and irreverent as mine (You can laugh at almost anything).

B.) A woman who doesn't need me to carry the conversation all the time (aka isn't afraid to speak her mind).

C.) A woman with something going on upstairs (aka you know what synergy and resonance mean...or at least you're motivated enough to crack the dictionary).

D.) You're a fan of flirting and being flirted with. If you DON'T, let's not waste each others time.

Turn Off's:
A:) If you're somebody who thinks that bored people are boring, then carry your ass, sister. You're probably a princess and I dont need the headache.

B.) Likewise if you're going to be offended by my self confidence and think it's arrogance or conceit. If that's offensive or threatening, keep moving. There's plenty of gals who like self confidence in a man.

C.) Ditto on preaching about morality. If I want a lecture, I'll go to the aforementioned church and try that ice cream sundae.

D.) Nit Pickers. See A, Princess types for details. I'm not here to try and fix what's wrong with anybody and I sure don't need somebody doing it to me.

The rest of you gals, crack that dictionary, look up synergy, and drop me a line ;)

title: IT'S SPRING! Let's get out of the city!
text:
Now that we have nicer weather and more daylight, I'm looking for some people to join me in the great outdoors. Day hikes, snowshoeing, ski touring, mountaineering, backpacking, etc. My main motivation for these trips is the wonderful way it makes me feel to be in a beautiful, pristine wilderness. To reach those quiet, largely untouched places I love, sometimes it just requires a meandering walk along nice trails, and other times it takes 2-3 hours of driving followed by 15, 20, even 25 miles of steep hiking over rough terrain. I don't go anywhere dangerous or extreme though, partly because I'm usually carting a bunch of camera gear! 

So I'm looking for people who are in pretty good shape for those longer trips, but are also fine with the simpler outings. And you'll have to put up with me stopping occasionally to set up a tripod and take lots of pictures. But hey, I have a high-clearance SUV that I can drive, and I'll offer to plan everything, so you shouldn't complain ;) Or if you want to take the lead planning and/or driving, that's fine too! 

I don't care if you're in a relationship, religious, or whatever. You should live near Seattle so we can easily meet for our trips, and we'd probably be able to relate better if you're somewhere around my age, say no more than 10-15 years apart. Other than that, just have a personality that's fun to be around! We can also hang out in the city sometimes, hitting up a happy hour or whatnot, and that might be a good way to meet initially, but mostly I just want friends who are up for lots of outdoor trips. Send me an email if you're interested!
dislikes: Those big boxy things all around me
interests: Those big pointy things on the horizon.

title: poetry
text:
lets dance on a bed of roses, shiitake, and cedar smoke
spiced with the love deep in our collective lower hearts
away from the irrational madness trumping stale flat drums.

let us inflate our wet pulsing beings unto warm sun sparkling mounds.
touch hands with kisses along moist forest paths seeking climactic
contentment. in the bounds of our arms, our lumbering legs
our finger tips slipping, inhale sweet sustenance over our gaping hungry lips.

shall we sneak away for a minute of infinite time to feel the earth move
and for just a few fleeting seconds live like a nebulae bellowing.

title: Help me cure my racism...
text:
Hello,

I'm not sure how else how to say this... but I'm a racist. Racist, tribalist, sexist, favoritist, whatever you call it...Pretty much anything outside of what a white Anglo-saxon male would normally encounter throughout his life while living in the states I see as unusual and odd. Perhaps it was how I was raised... Sad, I know. I think it means I haven't gotten outside of my comfort-zone enough... I'm 24, have been all over the world, including Thailand, Guam, Mexico, Europe, and there's still this underlying feeling that anything not familiar or foreign isn't seen as equal. WELL, that being said, I'm looking to change that. I've heard that the best way to overcome those feelings is to immerse yourself in whatever it is unknown - any way to alter to idea that makes me believe the United States isn't the center of the universe. I don't have the means currently to live in another country or travel for a while so I think the best thing to do would be to make a friends from another country, to exchange ideas, learn something from one another, see how the other lives, and so forth. 

Interested? Send me an email! Please include where you're from, a description about yourself, tips, anything you feel. 



Cheers

title: Warped, Wicked, & Irreverent
text:
Intelligent, educated, professional, WM with a truly wicked sense of humor and a flair for the erotic, seeks an e-buddy to build synergy and to resonate with.

I get bored as hell at work because I do the same thing over and over. Sometimes the only thing that keeps me out of the loony bin is chatting it up...texting, email, IM, talking on the phone...Hell it could be smoke signals (no, not THAT kind of smoke), carrier pigeons, or bongo drums and I'd still enjoy it.

What I'm looking for is to make a connection...To have that spark happen when intelligent conversation and flirting are mixed together with the rush of meeting somebody new. BOOM! Explosive?...Oh hell yes! I love it!

So then what happens, you ask. Well, I'm separated and I'm definitely not looking to change anybody's situation while I figure out mine. I'm really not expecting that we hook up, date, or even meet for an ice cream sundae at a church social (I've never done it in a church, lol...Have you?). At the end of the day, I'm just hoping to find a gal pal who both enjoys some male attention and giving a guy that same attention. Anything beyond that...let's cross that bridge if we ever get to it.

So let's talk about you: A woman (sorry guys, nothing personal, I just don't swing that way), 40-60 (the age is just a suggestion because we're likely to have more in common...but if you're under 40 or over 60 and you think you're up for the challenge, then by all means). Race, looks, religion, occupation, politics, astrological sign, blood type, favorite football team, etc etc are unimportant. Marital status...that's an interesting one. I prefer you to be married or divorced...But, as with the age, if you think you're up for it, then by all means.

Turn On's:
A.) A woman who has a sense of humor as warped and irreverent as mine (You can laugh at almost anything).

B.) A woman who doesn't need me to carry the conversation all the time (aka isn't afraid to speak her mind).

C.) A woman with something going on upstairs (aka you know what synergy and resonance mean...or at least you're motivated enough to crack the dictionary).

D.) You're a fan of flirting and being flirted with. If you DON'T, let's not waste each others time.

Turn Off's:
A:) If you're somebody who thinks that bored people are boring, then carry your ass, sister. You're probably a princess and I don't need the headache.

B.) Likewise if you're going to be offended by my self confidence and think it's arrogance or conceit. If that's offensive or threatening, keep moving. There's plenty of gals who like self confidence in a man.

C.) Ditto on preaching about morality. If I want a lecture, I'll go to the aforementioned church and try that ice cream sundae.

D.) Nit Pickers. See A, Princess types for details. I'm not here to try and fix what's wrong with anybody and I sure don't need somebody doing it to me.

The rest of you gals, crack that dictionary, look up synergy, and drop me a line ;)

title: Sober, beautiful, intelligent artist seeks buyer for art, friend
text:
Hi there.

I humbly write this posting. I will be quite straightforward about what I am seeking.

I am looking for someone who values or appreciates art, or who can use some of my other skills to help me to get back on my feet. It would be nice if this person might also become a friend, and that we could cultivate trust and understanding.

About me:

I am a beautiful person inside and out, very talented, and I make beautiful art and music. I have always been very driven in pursuing my dreams and have run my own small businesses. 3 years ago however, life just changed. Finally, I came to understand that I was suffering from PTSD. I was suffering a lot and I didn't recognize myself. I spiralled downwards into a crippling depression. I was looking for help everywhere, and as you may know, it can be very hard to find support and affordable therapy, especially for anything related to mental health. But the good news is, I did find some answers and some awesome therapy. But it didn't come cheap.

I guess this is how the cycle goes. I am doing therapy and feeling greatly restored, but I am diligently trying to hold onto my peace. I took loans to pay for my therapy, as I was desperate - and now those loans are due to the tune of $5g. Yep, I should not have gone to a loan shark. Desperation can make you do stupid things.

I am starting my life over again. I am sober and well and getting my pep back. I spent the last 6 months painting for my own meditation. My work is beautiful. I am looking for an art lover/appreciator who could buy my art/or - connect me to art buyrers and help me get back on my feet. I can also do commissions. Other skills I can offer are interior painting and decorating. I am a great decorator with great taste. Another skill I can offer is styling. I used to have a men's styling business when I lived in LA - again I have great taste and am great at dressing men.

The reason I am trying this route here on CL is because I am under the clock to pay this loan fast. I guess I need some kind of an angel. I am advertising my skills elsewhere and in the process of getting my businesses up and running. But I don't have a lot of time, and also, I am trying to keep myself balanced and well.

I am beautiful, fun, funny, smart and a great person to hang out with. I have had an incredible life with great stories to share and I'm a very good listener.

Maybe there is someone out there who has the means and interest to have a mutually supportive friendship with me.

Please write to me for photos of me and my art if you are interested. And please only respond if you are serious. I am a real person and I have been through a lot. It takes faith for me to do this.

Peace and gratitude~

title: Is she out there 2016
text:
I don't live in Washington right now, but I will be moving there before the end of the year. So I figured I post an ad now and hopefully start meeting people before I get. It seems hard to find that special person in Texas, or maybe she just doesn't live here. Even if it is true, it still feels lonely just waiting for the one. I don't want to have to go to some club just to find someone, just not my style. Even though I'm 25 (still young from what most people say) I'm just ready to start a serious relationship and let it grow. 

I'm in the army so it would be great if you were ok with that and understand what I have to deal with daily. We all want the morning and night text, the only thing that sucks about is each other waiting for the other to text first sometimes. 

I'm a guy and like most I'm not going to lie. I've cheated, been cheated on, lied and made mistakes, but we're all human right. I'm not saying I'm going to do that, but like said I'm not going to lie and say I've never done that or ssy I'm different other guys (maybe I am and maybe I'm not different, thats up to you). Like I said earlier I just want a serious relationship that will hopefully grow. 

Nice to be with someone at home and watch movies with while cuddling, not the 2015 "netflix and chill". Maybe go out somewhere around Texas, like kayaking in the summer getting lost in a road trip, going to a museum or even a walk around the town. 

I'm not the most affectionate man out there, but I do love doing surprises. As long as you don't take it for granted, I can be extremely romantic when I want to be. 

With all that being said I have tattoos, use to have pericing before I joined the army, I'm mixed (with that being said I'm mostly into Asian and white women, only cause if you knew my background we would have an extremely mixed baby). Race still isn't an issue for me or age just between 18-30, I mean I am 25. I'm extremely nerdy, but in a good way. 

If anything I just like to make new friends as well.

P.S. I don't do contract marriage.
